title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
Podspace is currently the fastest growing distribution & ad platform for podcasts in the Nordic region. Our mission is to support creators and media companies with technology to reach new heights, while simultaneously playing a crucial role in the dissemination of news, entertainment, ideas, and knowledge.
 



 We are looking for a backend developer to join our tight-knit product team and help us build the leading publishing and monetization tools for podcast creators.
 



  





 In the role you will develop new features and entire areas from start to finish and have a high level of autonomy in your work. You will collaborate with a small hybrid team, mainly located in our Stockholm office.
 



 Podspace is growing quickly and offers a dynamic start-up environment with big opportunities to grow and develop alongside the business. In short, this is a unique chance to join a great team early on and shape the future of our tech, product and company.
 



  





**About you:** 



* You are first and foremost a builder.
* You value working with people who are kind, ambitious and pragmatic.
* 5+ years of experience working as a software developer.
* Strong proficiency in Ruby and/or Golang, with a preference for experience in both.
* Strong proficiency in Typescript.
* Extensive experience with relational databases, particularly PostgreSQL.
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently or collaboratively in a team environment



  





**Nice to haves:** 



* Knowledge of containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
* Good understanding of database design and management.
* Experience and interest in AI and machine learning technologies.
* Experience from working in a start-up environment.



  





**What Podspace offers:** 



* A generous compensation package and benefits including stock options.
* We offer a hybrid workplace with flexible hours and the possibility of remote work, ideally within a time zone close to CET.
* A dynamic start-up environment that offers freedom, along with the necessary organization and goals, but without unnecessary processes, bureaucracy, rules, or office politics.
* Opportunities to grow with the company and play a key role in building something valuable together.
* A high-performing team and friendly, selfless colleagues without prestige and ego who work towards a common goal and take the time to celebrate the successes along the way.

title: AI Developer
description:
**Xensam: SAM Disrupters** 




 Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.
 



  





 We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.
 



  





**About the role** 




 We at Xensam are seeking an innovative and skilled AI Developer to join our dynamic team. This role is ideal for someone with a passion for cutting-edge machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies.
 



  





 As our AI Developer, you will be instrumental in designing, implementing, and deploying advanced AI models, with a strong focus on LLM and NLP.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




 You will develop and fine-tune AI models, including supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning techniques. You will also design and implement LLM and NLP models, employing techniques like LoRA and adapters for optimal performance. Other responsibilities that you will have:
 



  




* Preprocess and engineer features for large-scale datasets, ensuring readiness for model training.
* Deploy ML models to production using MLOps practices, containerization tools (e.g., Docker), and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Utilize frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch for neural network and ML model development.
* Optimize and evaluate model performance, implementing tuning strategies to improve results.
* Collaborate with multiple teams using Git, CI/CD pipelines, and Agile methodologies to deliver high-quality solutions.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Bachelor’s or higher degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
* Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and statistical methods.
* Proficiency in Python, with experience in NN and ML frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch.
* Experience in deploying machine learning models into production environments using MLOps best practices.
* Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Expertise in preprocessing large datasets and performing feature engineering for LLM training.
* Experience in training and fine-tuning LLMs and NLP models.
* Familiarity with Git, CI/CD pipelines, and effective collaboration within multidisciplinary teams, communicating technical concepts clearly.
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies and experience working in an Agile team.
* Strong proficiency in written and spoken English and preferably Swedish.



  





**What you get** 



* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* Free access to beverages, snacks, gym facilities, on-site massage, shuffleboard, and other games.
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.



  





**At Xensam, our core values define our culture** 




**Rebellious** 
 : We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.
 



**Humane** 
 : We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
 



**Harmonious** 
 : We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.
 



 Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive,
 **APPLY now!** 




  





 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: Project Developer
description:
**⚡️ What We Do**
 Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden’s industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.
   

  

 With an industry-leading AI-powered platform at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.
   

  

**🌟Who We Are**
 Tech company at heart – purpose in our DNA. Flower consists of a diverse group of innovative individuals with a strong desire to improve the state of the world.
   

  

 At Flower, we believe trust, collaboration and diversity are essential to not only create an inclusive work environment, but also drive career growth. By embracing varying perspectives, we allow creativity and progress to flourish.
   

  

 To accelerate towards our goal of becoming the pioneering force powering the energy system of tomorrow, we are now looking for a passionate and skilled Senior Project Developer.
   

  

**👩‍💻 About The Role**
 As a Senior Project Developer at Flower, you will lead the development of large scale battery systems and other types flexible assets. You will be responsible for projects throughout the entire value until Ready to Build, while working closely with the development team building batteries throughout the Nordics and Europe.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Lead the development of projects in all stages, from Green Field to Ready to Build, ensuring project success through efficient timeline, budget, and resource management.
* Conduct technical assessments, secure grid connections, and oversee permitting processes in collaboration with Flower’s internal technical teams and external stakeholders.
* Negotiate with landowners, grid operators, and other stakeholders to optimize project timelines and resources.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with external stakeholders, including landowners, industries, grid operators, authorities, municipalities, and local communities. Navigate complex regulatory landscapes to speed up processes and drive project success.
* Manage the preparation and submission of necessary permits and approvals, ensuring all projects comply with local, regional, and national regulations.
* Ensure that your projects are financially solid and that they align with company requirements.
* Identify and address potential risks through proactive planning and problem-solving, ensuring the smooth progression of projects.
* Represent the company at industry events, public meetings, and regulatory hearings, strengthening Flower’s presence in the renewable energy sector.
* Collaborate closely with internal teams to ensure seamless integration of technical expertise and strategic alignment.


 At Flower, we want to be on the forefront of the transition. This means that we will expand the portfolio of what we develop. New technologies means a resourceful and solution-oriented mindset when finding ways to develop, overcome project challenges and drive innovation. You will optimize the way we develop projects by always looking for new ways to enable a faster and better development process.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering, Renewable Energy, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience in project development within the renewable energy sector.
* Proven track record of successfully developing and delivering large-scale projects.
* Strong technical background and expertise in the energy sector.
* In-depth knowledge of the Nordic energy market and regulatory environment.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Experience with grid connection processes for large projects in the Nordic region is highly valued.
* Proficiency in English and Swedish; knowledge of Finnish or Danish is a plus.


**📍 Location**
 Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from Slussen subway station. We encourage in-office collaboration but support a hybrid work model.
   

  

**✉️ Apply**
 To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and what you think you could bring to our team. Throughout the recruitment process you will meet with the People & Talent Partner, Head of Asset Development nordics, VP of Asset Development, and our CEO.
   

  

 Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office. We therefore appreciate it if you could submit your CV in English.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**Please note, we will start reviewing candidates at the end of January. Flower wish you a delightful holiday!**
*We kindly but firmly decline any engagement in recruitment assistance for our hiring processes. This includes partnership offers or the sale of recruitment tools.*

title: Senior Java Developer to the Responsible Gaming team
description:
Paf is a pioneering Nordic gaming company, founded on the Åland Islands in 1966 with a unique mission: to generate funds for the greater good of society. As one of the first gaming companies to launch online in 1999, we continue to lead the industry with innovative, exclusive games developed by our in-house Games Studio.
 



 Committed to creating a safer gaming environment, we are proud to be an award-winning leader in responsible gaming, setting new standards that put players first.
 







 We are now looking for our sixth developer to join the Responsible Gaming team to help drive our continued success.
 



  





  

**THE TEAM**
 Our Responsible Gaming team plays a key role in our vision of being a sustainable and responsible business. 
   

  

 In this role, you will be part of a highly experienced and skilled team where openness and everyone’s contributions and opinions are valued. We work together in everything we do, fostering a team spirit and an open-minded atmosphere where everyone's contributions are truly valued.
 



  





**THE ROLE**
 You will engage in the entire development process, from requirement specification, story creation, and estimation to development, testing, release, and maintenance. 
   

  

 You will also work with: 
 


* **Project Leadership:** 
 Take charge of leading projects from initiation to completion, ensuring successful delivery and implementation.
* **Full Lifecycle Engagement:** 
 Engage in all development stages of our integration platform, focusing on stability, maintainability, and adaptability to rapidly incorporate new features, rules and requirements. Emphasis on low code debt and clear, understandable code is essential.
* **Architectural Influence:** 
 Use your Java expertise to contribute to architectural decisions, with an understanding of their long-term impact on the project.
* **Mentorship:** 
 Offer guidance and mentorship to more junior team members, fostering their growth and development within the team.



  





  





**YOUR PROFILE**
 To thrive here, you should be truly curious and passionate about software development. You are confident in taking initiative and working independently, yet equally comfortable and interested in collaborating with others. Driven and proactive, you don’t hesitate to ask for assistance when needed.
   

  

 Seen to the technical elements of the role, we are looking for an experienced
 **Java** 
 Developer with
 **at least** 
 five years of experience in Java development. Proficiency in modern
 **Java frameworks** 
 , particularly
 **Spring Boot** 
 , is essential for our projects. Additionally, experience with
 **Kafka for messaging** 
 and
 **PostgreSQL** 
 for database management is required, as these technologies are integral to our systems. Familiarity with cloud platforms, such as
 **AWS** 
 or other cloud services, is also important to support our cloud-based projects.
 



**Additional skills that will make you stand out:** 



* **High-Volume Transaction Systems Experience:** 
 A background in managing systems with intense transactional demands is highly valued.
* **Leadership for Large Projects:** 
 Successfully led and delivered larger-scale projects from start to finish.
* **Mentorship Abilities:** 
 Experience in coaching more junior team members, fostering their development with clear guidance and constructive feedback in a supportive environment.



  









**WE OFFER** 



* A company with steady growth since it's founding in 1966.
* Occupational healthcare and insurance.
* A culture of care, creativity and collaboration
* A workplace that encourages individuality and personal growth.
* A strong focus on well-being over short-term goals, valuing sustained contributions and work-life balance. We strive to avoid overtime unless absolutely necessary.
* A hybrid remote arrangement, including coverage for your Wi-Fi and home office setup.



  

  













**INFORMATION** 




**Start Date:** 
 As soon as possible, subject to notice period requirements.
 



**Duration:** 
 Full-time/Permanent with a six-month probation period.
 



**Remote work/location:** 
 Requirement of being in the office for a few days per week.
 


* **In Stockholm:** 
 A modern and vibrant co-working office with a 9th-floor view at
 *United Spaces,* 
 Klarabergsviadukten 63. Including weekly breakfasts, afterworks, Gym, yoga-classes, events and a lot more.
* **In Marie** 
**hamn:** 
 Our headquarters in Mariehamn offers a light, open and modern building. 120+ Paf Employees are based here, engaging over weekly breakfasts, seminars, events and an office gym, in-house massage, free use of bikes and plenty other benefits.











**Application:** 
 Applications are only accepted via the application form. Due to GDPR compliance, we cannot accept applications via email.
 



 We are actively reviewing applications and will close the position once the right candidate is found.
 



**Recruitment Process:** 
 The process includes a programming assessment.

title: Business Developer - Southeast Asia
description:
In a world where product size labels are unreliable, Volumental is the footwear industry's leading FitTech™ company. Our vision is a world without sizes, where every body fits. Our FitTech uses 3D scans and a one-of-a-kind, AI-powered recommendation engine to match everyone with the shoes that fit them best.
   

  

 With top brand and retail partners worldwide, including New Balance, Red Wing Shoes, Fleet Feet, The Athlete's Foot, Ecco, Intersport, and XXL, our footprint spans 3000+ stores across 54 countries, and growing!
   

  

 We are now looking for a Business Developer to join our Commercial Team and help us grow and nurture our partnerships in Southeast Asia. This role requires a creative and proactive thinker who thrives on building relationships, driving revenue, and delivering real impact for our customers.
   

  

 You’ll be the bridge between Volumental and our customers—ensuring they are set up for success while also identifying opportunities to expand their engagement with our solutions. The person in this role will be based locally in Indonesia, working closely with regional and global teams to expand Volumental’s footprint in the market.
   

  

 From onboarding and training to performance monitoring and strategic account growth, you’ll work closely with stakeholders across the footwear industry, from HQ decision-makers to in-store teams.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Identify and secure new business opportunities and upsell or expand existing partnerships to drive revenue growth.
* Own and grow a portfolio of international footwear retailers and distributors across Southeast Asia, ensuring they maximize the value of Volumental’s solutions.
* Lead customer onboarding and training, ensuring smooth rollouts and high product adoption.
* Monitor customer performance at organizational and store levels, providing actionable insights to optimize product usage.
* Collaborate with internal teams, including Product and Customer Experience, to ensure successful implementation and long-term customer success.
* Monthly travel within Southeast Asia to meet customers, support store launches, and build strong relationships.


**Who You Are**
* A relationship-driven professional with 3+ years of experience in account management, sales, or customer success, ideally in SaaS, retail tech, or footwear.
* A strong communicator who can influence stakeholders at all levels, from store staff to C-suite.
* Someone who loves both strategy and execution – you can spot big-picture opportunities while also rolling up your sleeves to make things happen.
* Passionate about technology and retail, with a curiosity to learn and innovate.
* Fluent in English and Bahasa Indonesia.
* Based in Indonesia and comfortable with frequent regional travel, plus occasional trips to our Stockholm HQ to collaborate with Swedish colleagues and engage in global projects across time zones.


**Bonus!**
 Don’t let these stop you from applying, but please let us know if they fit you:
   

  

* Experience working with footwear retailers or distributors in Southeast Asia.
* Experience working with sales of SaaS solutions.
* Experience selling to footwear retailers or brands.
* Experience working with e-commerce platforms.
* Familiarity with other regional languages.


**What We Offer You**
* Competitive remuneration and attractive commission structure.
* Opportunity to work with a dynamic, international team.
* The chance to be a part of a growing global brand.


 This is a full-time, remote position reporting to the Chief Commercial Officer at Volumental, with opportunities to travel to our Headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden—where you'll collaborate with our talented Swedish colleagues and experience our innovative work culture firsthand.
   

  

 At Volumental, we value innovation, collaboration, and a commitment to customer success. We strive to create an inclusive and supportive environment where all team members can thrive. We encourage a diversity of applicants to apply!

title: ETL Developer
Senior Embedded Software Developer (MedTech) -Malmö/Lund, Sweden
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a Senior Embedded Software Developer (MedTech) 🚀**
**Location:** 
 Malmö/Lund, Sweden
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Fulltime , Onsite
   

  

**Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our Senior Embedded Software Developer (MedTech)**
**About VIPAS**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Vipas AB is seeking a
 **Senior Embedded Software Developer** 
 for a long-term assignment with one of our clients in the
 **MedTech** 
 industry. This role requires a strong system understanding of software development for medical devices, including hardware connections and embedded system architecture. We are looking for a candidate with a deep passion for embedded development and experience working with multiple embedded platforms and operating systems.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and optimize embedded software solutions for MedTech products.
* Understand and interpret customer needs and transform them into manufacturable designs.
* Work with various embedded platforms and operating systems to build robust solutions.
* Collaborate with hardware teams to ensure seamless integration of software and hardware components.
* Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and simple manner.
* Contribute to device driver development and real-time operating systems (RTOS) integration.
* Participate in team discussions and support both small and large project teams.


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience in embedded software development.
* Strong proficiency in C/C++ for embedded systems.
* Experience in device driver development.
* Familiarity with real-time operating systems (RTOS).
* Open-minded and passionate about embedded development.
* Excellent communication skills in spoken and written English.


**Preferred Skills (Nice to Have):**
* Experience with medical device software development (IEC 62304 compliance).
* Knowledge of open-source development and configuration management tools like Git, Gerrit, Jenkins, GitLab.
* Familiarity with connectivity standards (Bluetooth, WiFi, NFC, LTE).
* Debugging experience using Jlink, ST-Link, Lauterbach, Trace32.
* Hands-on experience with measuring instruments such as oscilloscopes and logic analyzers.
* Security expertise in keys, certificates, TLS/SSL.
* Experience with electronics hardware bring-up and bootloaders.
* Understanding of Embedded Linux, Yocto, Buildroot.
* Cloud communication knowledge using MQTT or REST.
* Exposure to safety-classified software development


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

**Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at sandhya@vipas.se**
**Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.**
**How To Apply**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Java Developer
description:
HiQ är utan tvekan ett av Sveriges mest tekniktunga och spännande konsultbolag med kunder inom en rad olika branscher. Som Javautvecklare hos oss har vi ett brett utbud av spännande uppdrag hos våra större teknikintensiva kunder, t.ex produktbolag inom industrin, elkraft, försvar och autonoma fordon.
   

  

 För oss är din utveckling i fokus, oavsett om du bara har jobbat några år eller om du är en senior Javautvecklare. Hos oss utvecklas du självklart i dina uppdrag, där du har möjlighet att lära dig t.ex. nya tekniker och vi jobbar också mycket med det kollegiala lärandet genom kunskapsdelning mellan varandra.
   

  

 För att passa i rollen ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Högskole-/Civilingenjörsexamen inom datavetenskap, datateknik, teknisk fysik, elektroteknik eller motsvarande
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Javautveckling
* Talar flytande svenska och engelska


 På HiQ arbetar personer med rätt attityd och rätt kompetens – det gör oss till ett smart, men också väldigt roligt gäng. Brinner du också för att förenkla och förbättra människors vardag genom digitala lösningar? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan i dag!

title: Developer ASIC
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 Are you passionate about creating world-leading ASICs for the next generation of mobile networks? Here’s your chance to contribute to cutting-edge 5G and 6G technologies that power Ericsson product portfolio. Our department is at the forefront of developing advanced ASIC solutions for mobile network systems. We specialize in designing a powerful signal processing platform, featuring: DSP-cores, Common memory architectures, Sophisticated hardware accelerators for beamforming, encoding, FFT algorithms, and more.
   

  

 These highly configurable and tailored architectures form the backbone of Ericsson baseband and radio products. We look forward for you as an ASIC Design Engineer to join our talented team responsible for the development of a complex job distribution and scheduling subsystem.
   

  

**What You Will Do.**
* Create advanced, power-efficient digital blocks using SystemVerilog or VHDL, maintaining high precision, scalability and reliability standards.
* Collaborate with system architects to define and implement groundbreaking microarchitectures that drive performance and efficiency.
* Partner with verification engineers in a continuous feedback loop to ensure robust and high-quality designs.
* Collaborate closely with backend teams to achieve timing closure and enhance designs for optimal power and performance.
* Play a key role in a dynamic, multidisciplinary team, pushing the boundaries of innovation in mobile network technology.


**Skills You Bring.**
* Demonstrated proficiency in ASIC digital design using SystemVerilog or VHDL, backed by several years of hands-on experience.
* Experience of debugging, linting, synthesis tools, timing closure, power, and optimization challenges.
* Proven track record in micro-architecture/systemisation, showcasing your ability to conceptualise and implement complex designs.
* Technical problem-solving skills, an aptitude for creative solutions, capturing opportunities and being able to write maintainable code.
* Collaborative mindset, fostering teamwork, give and receive feedback, eager to learn and communication skills.
* Understanding agile way of working, source control and continuous integration tools, preferable experience of using GIT and Jenkins.
* A Master of Science degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or an equivalent qualification.


**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 [[Sweden]] || [[Stockholm]]
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 [[Anitha Pulluru]]
   

  

**Hiring Manager:** 
 [[Bernt Gustafsson]]
   

  

 ]]>

title: Mobile SDK Developer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We are a forward-thinking team creating cutting-edge, cloud-based communication solutions. Our mobile client SDKs are key to how our customers integrate their products with our platform. We have clients ranging from small businesses to large enterprises, and their mobile apps are used by millions of people worldwide. By developing our voice and video SDKs together with the team, you will play a pivotal role in powering all those real-time conversations.
   

  

**Role**
 As a Mobile SDK Engineer, you'll take ownership of developing and maintaining high-performing mobile SDKs while contributing to all stages of the software lifecycle. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop SDKs using WebRTC technology to optimize real-time communication features.
* Work with the team to align SDK APIs and features across multiple platforms, including iOS, Android, and Web/JavaScript.
* Develop cross-platform solutions using a C++ codebase shared between iOS and Android.
* Design APIs with simplicity in mind while maintaining modularity, extensibility, and API stability over time.
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, with a focus on system performance and scalability.
* Enhance automation, streamline CI/CD pipelines, and troubleshoot issues proactively.
* Influence architectural decisions and actively contribute to enhancing our development and operational practices.


**Requirements**
* Professional expertise in modern C++, especially in mobile applications development.
* Professional experience developing for the iOS and/or Android platform.
* Experience with at least one of Kotlin or Objective-C/Swift.
* Experience working in Linux/macOS development environments and CI pipelines.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
* A passion for clean, testable code and modern software practices.


**Good to have**
* Experience with WebRTC protocols and NAT traversal, including ICE, STUN, and TURN, is a significant advantage.
* Experience developing software libraries and/or SDKs consumed by other developers.
* In-depth knowledge of network protocols such as IP, TCP, UDP, and DNS.
* Great debugging and troubleshooting skills.


 Embrace the challenge and join us! You will have the chance to:
   

  

* Work with a talented and diverse team in a culture that values innovation and collaboration.
* Take on meaningful challenges and grow with the latest technologies.
* Enjoy flexibility with hybrid work options and a healthy work-life balance.
* Benefit from competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare insurance, pension contributions, and wellness allowance.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Senior Systemutvecklare/Lead developer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Tillsammans med Scrum master etablera ett nytt uvecklingsteam
   

  

 Designa, dokumentera och komunicera de tekniska lösningarna
   

  

 Säkerställa kvalitet i den valda lösningen
   

  

 Delta i det dagliga utvecklingsarbetet genom att analysera krav och implementera lösningar utifrån dessa
   

  

 Bidra aktivt med kompetensspridning
   

  

 Vara behjälplig vid rekryteringar av utvecklare
   

  

 Vara mentor för andra utvecklare
   

  

 Bidra med förslag till effektivare arbetssätt
   

  

 Utifrån ett systemutvecklingsperspektiv vara delaktig vid planering och prioritering av uppgifter
   

  

 Delta i support och förvaltningsaktiviteter vid behov
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 8 års arbetserfarenhet av Java
* Minst 5 års arbete där Springboot varit centalt
* Minst 5 år som lösningsarkitekt eller lead developer de senaste 10 åren
* Minst 1 år med Angular/React
* Minst 3 år med OpenShift eller Kubernetes
* Minst 5 år med komplexa integrationer, kö-hantering och releationsdatabaser
* Arbete i ledande position i minst ett nyutvecklingsprojekt
* Arbete i projekt som utvecklar ärendehanteringssystem


**Meriterande**
* Arbetserfarenhet av betallösningar
* Tidigare arbetat på myndighet
* Arbetat med Artemis senaste 3 åren


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 17-02-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer
description:
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.**
**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**
 Do you want to help build the future of customer experiences? We are looking for a driven and dedicated
 **Senior** 
**Fullstack Engineer** 
 to strengthen our Insurance team. With us, you will have the opportunity to work on exciting and challenging projects in a fast-growing and innovative environment.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Senior Fullstack Engineer, you will play a key role in the development and maintenance of our customer-facing applications and mission-critical backend services. You will work in a cross-functional team within a multi-product organization, where you will contribute to creating scalable and robust solutions for both the frontend and backend.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 In the position you will design, develop, and maintain customer-facing applications and mission-critical backend services. You will collaborate within a cross-functional team in a multi-product organization to build and maintain scalable and resilient frontend and backend solutions. Ensuring the performance and accessibility of our customer-facing products, you'll work with component libraries, adhere to brand guidelines, and conduct A/B testing and experimentation to optimize user experience.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Must-Have:**
* Solid experience with JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, Node.js, and React.
* Experience building and maintaining mission-critical backend APIs.
* Experience developing customer-facing products with a focus on performance and accessibility.
* Experience working with cloud-hosted applications and CI/CD pipelines.
* Experience managing complex state management in React/Redux.
* Experience with MySQL and MongoDB.


**Nice To Have**
* Experience in React Native.
* Experience in Next.js.
* Eye for design and UX.
* Experience in AWS.
* Experience contributing to design systems.
* Experience with tracking user events.
* Experience running A/B tests.
* Experience from fintech or insurance focused businesses.


**What We Offer**
* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.


 We have an office-first policy on a monthly basis to promote a balance between physical collaboration and flexibility, while the remote days can be spent anywhere in the world.
   

  

 Please note!
   

  

 As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.
   

  

 Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banks’ offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 350 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in Sweden, Finland and Denmark.

title: System Architect
job_function: Information Technology and Health Care Provider
company_industry: Public Safety and Health and Human Services
description:
*På SOS Alarm har vi ett viktigt uppdrag: att skapa trygghet för alla, dygnet runt, året om. Vi utvecklar smarta lösningar och tjänster som stärker samhällets förmåga att hantera kriser, olyckor och nödsituationer.* 




  





*Vill du arbeta i en nyckelroll där din tekniska kompetens gör konkret samhällsnytta?* 




*På SOS Alarm får du vara med och bygga robusta, pålitliga system som räddar liv. Vi söker nu en Systemarkitekt som vill vara med och utveckla våra viktiga Automatlarm.* 




  





  





 DIN VARDAG SOM SYSTEMARKITEKT
 



 I denna roll kommer du att tillhöra vårt agila Produktteam Automatlarm där vi arbetar med den tekniska plattformen för mottagning av automatiska larm, alltifrån brandlarm till trygghetslarm och personlarm, in till vår larmcentral. Det hjälper oss att tillsammans rädda liv dygnet runt, året om och göra Sverige tryggare för alla.
 



  





  





 Som Systemarkitekt ansvarar du för våra mjukvarulösningar. Utifrån ställda krav tar du fram lösningsdesign och systemdesign, är med och utvecklar och förbereder för att gå live. Detta ger dig en teknikledande roll i teamet där du tar ansvar för systemövergripande frågor i det dagliga arbetet. Det involverar även förståelse för, och kontakter med omkringliggande system och team. Du säkerställer att vi gör kloka val kring systemens uppbyggnad och drivs av att vilja leverera värde för våra användare, samtidigt som du väger in andra faktorer såsom förvaltningsbarhet och säkerhet. I roller kommer du till viss del även arbeta med backendutveckling när behov uppstår.
 



  





  





 Våra system byggs primärt i .NET/C# (backend) och Angular (Frontend/webb). Vi arbetar i Microsoftmiljöer, primärt med onpremlösningar men även Azure förekommer. Arbetsmetodiken är scrum med Jira som planeringsverktyg. En fast del av utvecklingsteamets arbetstid är avsatt till egen kompetensutveckling och innovation med särskilt inplanerade dagar för detta i slutet av varje sprint.
 



  





  





 DIN BAKGRUND
 



 Vi söker dig som brinner för Systemarkitektur, du är driven, målinriktad, gillar att samarbeta och sprida kunskaper till andra och du har en förmåga att förklara lösningar och få alla i teamet att jobba mot samma mål. Du är utvecklare i grunden och tycker om att jobba med kod men du vill även lyfta blicken och jobba med systemarkitektur. Rollen passar dig som är Lead Developer eller liknande och du vill ta en Systemarkitekturansvar eller så arbetar du i en Systemarkitektroll idag och vill komma in med din kompetens till SOS Alarm i denna nyckelroll.
 



  





  





**Kompetensmässigt söker vi dig som har:** 



* Fullstack: Goda kunskaper i C#/.Net och kunskaper även inom Frontendutveckling
* Erfarenhet av Systemdesign
* Erfarenhet av datakommunikation (gärna protokollkonvertering) i någon form, telekomerfarenhet är också användbart
* Git
* AzureDevOps
* Jira



  





  





 Hos oss är våra värderingar,
 **Professionella & Empatiska** 
 samt
 **Ansvarstagande & Samverkande** 
 , något som genomsyrar hela kulturen på SOS Alarm och att du kan relatera till dessa är en förutsättning för att trivas hos oss!
 



  





  





  





 MER OM OSS SOM ARBETSPLATS
 



 Vi på SOS Alarm arbetar för ett tryggare Sverige för alla. Det gör vi genom att hjälpa människor i nödsituationer, hantera larm, koordinera arbete vid olyckor och kriser, samt genom att aktivt bevaka händelser och trender på nationell och global nivå. Vi gör allt detta i samverkan med våra kunder och partners - dygnet runt, årets alla dagar. Många är framför allt bekanta med vår leverans av det nationella nödnumret 112, men vi erbjuder även ett växande antal innovativa tjänster för både den privata och offentliga marknaden.
 



  





 Vi sitter i fina lokaler centrala Stockholm.
 



  





  





 ANSÖKAN
 



 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med House of Skills.
 



 Har du frågor? Kontakta gärna Linda Mukka (linda.mukka@houseofskills.se) eller Linda Freij (linda.freij@houseofskills.se).
 



  





  





 Urval sker löpande, så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
 



*SOS Alarm genomför säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll på sin personal enligt kraven ur säkerhetsskyddslag (2018:585). Även en kontroll enligt Lag (1974:191) om bevakningsföretag utförs och är aktiv under anställningsperioden. Drogtest utan anmärkning är en förutsättning för anställning. Tjänsten innebär även krigsplacering vid SOS Alarm.*

title: Identity Security Developer
description:
Are you ready for a change? To make the world a safer place?
   

  

 ID North offers products and services in the entire field of identity security (IAM, IGA, PAM), which is a central part of IT security. We are the leading company in Sweden and intend to further distance ourselves from the competition in the entire Nordics. We are on an exciting growth journey, which is why we are now looking for more solution developers who want to join our team and develop tomorrow’s identity security solutions for our customers!
   

  

**Your mission** 
 📌
   

  

 As a Developer, you will implement advanced solutions based on the customer’s needs and requirements, such as secure login, integration for automatic account creation, and management of administrator rights. The assignments are technically exciting and challenging, and those passionate about developing technical breadth are in the right place to become an expert. Working together in a project team with a project manager, solution architect, and solution developer, you will be involved in delivering top-notch identity security solutions within Project Delivery and/or our Service Delivery Organization!
   

  

**In your role, you will need to:** 
 💻
   

  

 Have an interest in configuring technically broad solutions in complex environments using market-leading products tailored to the customer’s needs.
   

  

 Be able to integrate systems for secure login and information flows for identities, accounts, and permissions.
   

  

 Work with customers and help them understand the solution being built.
   

  

 It is a merit to have worked with IAM, IGA, and/or PAM solutions before with the technology of one of our solution partners.
   

  

 Knowledge of Active Directory/LDAP, Web Services, and standards such as SAML, OpenID Connect, OAuth2, SCIM is advantageous.
   

  

 It is also a merit to have knowledge and experience with Linux and Windows environments, MySQL and MSSQL databases, Java and Tomcat, Apache httpd, certificate management/SSL/TLS/PKI.
   

  

 Version control and release management with tools like Subversion or Git, as well as Ant or Maven, are advantageous.
   

  

 Experience and knowledge with identity security products from SailPoint, Savyint Opentext, Okta, Nexus, CyberArk, Microsoft is a major plus.
   

  

 There may be business trips in the role. We have offices in Stockholm, Borås, Gothenburg, Denmark and Helsinki, so your location can be flexible based on your needs and life situation.
   

  

**Your competence** 
 📓
   

  

 We are looking for someone with an IT technical developer background. Experience and knowledge in identity security are highly valued but not a requirement. We prefer if you have worked in teams/projects with customers as consultants and are unafraid to take on new technical challenges. Understanding of information flows, system integration, and basic programming skills are advantageous. You can communicate fluently in both Swedish and English, both spoken and written. A major merit if you have other language skills.
   

  

**Your qualities** 
**⭐️**
 You enjoy working in teams with colleagues and customers, and you like to develop advanced technical solutions that require a broad technical understanding. We prefer that you are solution-oriented and interested in learning how to implement solutions with new products. Are eager to learn and develop your skills and competence. We value your personal qualities highly and are looking for someone who is attentive, has good social skills, and is easy to collaborate with others, both colleagues and customers.
   

  

**We offer** 
 🚀
   

  

 A strong and pleasant company at the forefront of our field, where our expertise and experience give us a competitive position. We offer development opportunities, and you will be surrounded by specialists. All day every day! At ID North, you have good employment benefits, and you will become a key person for us in our delivery. We enjoy each other’s company and take the opportunity to go on trips, adventures, and have fun together on our journey to the top.
   

  

 Does this sound like a position for you? We have an immediate need, so you should not hesitate to apply or send your application. Are you IN?
   

  

 Welcome- Chief Human Resources Officer Linda Öhlin

title: Tech Lead Manager
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 You will act as both Tech Lead and Manager, in a perfect mix of leading people (Team of Developers) and developing code. Our aim is to consolidate the team of developers that you will lead in Stockholm. You will collaborate with your Product Partner, regarding planning and building the right products at the right time. You will be responsible for defining clear goals for your team and lead them in delivering on those goals.
   

  

 Apart from this, you are also responsible for setting salaries, helping individuals on your team grow and developing, as well as contributing technically to the team.
   

  

 As Tech Lead Manager you have a holistic perspective and the ability to inspire and lead others. You love working with tech and have experience working as a developer, working with code reviews, testing and quality assurance. You have at least one area where your team can rely on you making strong technical contributions.
   

  

* Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders
* Define quarterly goals and do weekly follow-ups
* Support and make sure the team members are the best they can be
* Develop and coach your team members individually
* Facilitate daily stand-ups and advise on agile WoW
* Contribute technically (wherever your strong area is) to the team


**Requirements**
* MSc/BS in computer science or similar degree
* Experience working as a Manager for a Tech Team
* Working in different contexts and organisations
* Interest in leadership and developing teams
* Proficient in English, both verbal and written
* Business minded and able to see the big picture
* A natural leader who is caring and inspiring
* Able to communicate clearly, both with your team and stakeholders
* Well organized and goal oriented


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Senior Dotnet Developer
description:
**Please note that working proficiency in Swedish language is a requrement** 




  




* Är du en senior utvecklare inom C# .Net & React, samt älskar att resa på fritiden?
* Vill du bidra till att skapa en kundresa & reseupplevelse i världsklass för våra kunder?
* Vill du arbeta i en familjär, varm och omtänksam företagskultur ihop med dedikerade och riktigt kompetenta medarbetare som delar med sig av sin expertis?



  





*Då är rollen som Senior Fullstackutvecklare på Apollo som klippt och skuren för dig som söker en modern och kompetent utvecklingsmiljö, läs gärna vidare!* 




  





**Bakgrund** 




 För Apollo är utveckling lika viktigt som Grekland och världen. Att utveckla tjänster och produkter som ger våra slutkunder den bästa upplevelsen, innan, under och efter resan är ständigt i fokus för oss. Vi har nyligen bytt ut vårt CMS och PIM till Contentful, samtidigt har vi skapat en tydligare struktur där både utvecklare och produktägare fått ännu större befogenheter och ansvar
 *för vår plattform.* 
 85% av Apollos försäljning sker online och vi lägger stor vikt vid att kontinuerligt förbättra kundupplevelsen genom att driva innovation som hjälper våra kunder att hitta, konfigurera och beställa sin drömresa. Våra utvecklingsteam tillsammans med våra produktägare och UX designers driver gemensamt utvecklingen av sitt område framåt, både på produktnivå såväl som tekniskt. Vi arbetar nära övriga avdelningar för att säkerställa att vi på bästa sätt nyttjar den långa och breda erfarenhet vi som organisation har om de resor vi erbjuder.
 



 Tjänsteplacering kommer att vara på huvudkontoret på Ynglingagatan i Stockholm, här sitter ca 170 av våra medarbetare varav 50 av dessa jobbar inom IT.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




 Vi söker en erfaren utvecklare med ca fem plus år yrkesrelaterad erfarenhet inom Fullstack C# .Net & React, med fördel en konsultbakgrund. Du uttrycker dig väl på svenska i tal och skrift.
 



  





***Meriterande men inte ett krav:***




  





 Erfarenhet inom Contentful, gärna CMS och PIM, personification och gamification, CI, Cloud Services som AWS eller Azure samt Terraform.
 



  





**Personlighet** 




 Då utvecklingsteamet arbetar riktigt verksamhetsnära är förmågan till goda relationer samt stort intresse för övriga delar av Apollo viktigt. Apollo andas och lever tillsammans, lagandan är tydlig och man utmanar gärna varandra positivt för att nå framgång. Branschen och Apollo är snabbrörliga, agila och så även du. Vidare är du en nyfiken social och kreativ lagspelare, kompetent, kommunikativ och stolt över ditt yrkeskunnande. Du delar med dig av din kunskap, är bra på att ge och ta konstruktiv feedback samt mån om att arbeta med kontinuerlig förbättring av såväl dig själv som verksamheten.
 



  





**Vårt erbjudande** 




 Apollo erbjuder en stimulerande och kreativ arbetsmiljö med varierande arbetsuppgifter som du har stor möjlighet att påverka. Vi har en platt organisation som uppmuntrar samarbete, kommunikation och delande av idéer inom och mellan olika avdelningar på Apollo. Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats där affären är viktigt samtidigt som vi har roligt och en bra balans mellan jobb och privatliv. Frågar vi våra utvecklare så beskrivs vi som en organisation där du uppmanas och har utrymme att lyfta idéer kring hemsidan eller teknikval. Vi ser också till att faktiskt testa nya tekniker vilket gör att vi ständigt utvecklas och utmanas, tillsammans i teamen! Utöver detta kommer du givetvis att erbjudas riktigt bra deals på resor utöver redan schyssta förmåner.
 



  





**Kontakt & Ansökan** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Aliby – The Pink Company. Då intervjuer och urval sker löpande ber vi dig att inte vänta med din ansökan. Vid intresse vänligen kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Omar Burazerovic på 0728–897441
 



  





**Om Apollo** 




 Apollo är en branschledande researrangör som underlättat för skandinaver att komma ut i världen, först med resor till Grekland till att nu kunna erbjuda hela världen till våra kunder. Vi gör det genom vårt charterbolag Apollo, men även genom våra systerbolag Xtravel, Golf Plaisir, Out of Bounds och Lime Travel. Med mer än 35 år i branschen så fortsätter vi att växa och söker därför efter fler kompetenta IT-medarbetare som tillsammans med oss vill skapa resebranschens bästa kundresa, oavsett om den sker digitalt eller på en sandstrand i Grekland. Sedan 2015 är Apollo en del av den privatägda tyska koncernen REWE med över 300 000 medarbetare. REWE är stora inom dagligvaruhandel, sällanköp, reseindustrin, med mera. En stark ägare som även har fler andra resebolag i Europa inom koncernen som vi samarbetar med.

title: SAP Consultant
description:
**Job Title: SAP Embedded BPC Developer** 




**Location: Stockholm, Sweden** 




**B2B contract** 




  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking an experienced SAP Embedded BPC Developer to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and supporting solutions within SAP Embedded BPC, ensuring optimal system performance and functionality.
 



  





**Must Have skills:** 



* Managing the day-to-day provision of maintenance and support as subject matter expert in reporting/ report configuration with SAP and non-SAP tools.
* Development and support of all BPC objects that includes reports, input templates, master/meta data, logic scripts, business rules, BPF, work status, batch schedules
* Resolve Finance domain business issues related to SAP Finance and Controlling (FI/CO), Business Planning and Consolidation (BPC) and any deployed applications that directly support the finance domain
* Lead all projects/enhancements/changes related to SAP Finance domain
* Knowledge of architecture standard and industry best practices in SAP BPC domains
* Perform SAP BPC system configuration such as business process flow and business rules.
* Build SAP BPC model & dimension
* Perform SAP BPC system configuration such as business process flow and business rules.
* Partake in System Integration Test and User Acceptance Test script making and provide support for issue handling.
* Perform deployment of development objects throughout 3-tier landscape (Dev, QA, Production)
* Compose functional & technical design document where applicable
* Engage closely with end users, Business Process Owners and SAP BPC functional consultants for finalization of functional specifications and report formats for Business Warehouse
* Ability to troubleshoot issues relating to BPC in a timely manner
* Developing, designing, implementing and supporting business processes in an SAP environment
* Experience working on an SAP BPC Net weaver 10.0



  





**Good to Have:** 



* Well versed in usage of ABAP and script logic
* Extensive knowledge in data modelling in SAP BPC
* Experience in SAP S4HANA or ECC finance related modules is a plus
* Relevant SAP certifications are a plus
* Minimum of 10 years of relevant experience in SAP Business Planning & Consolidation
* Extensive experience in Embedded BPC Latest version or earlier
* Extensive experience in SAP BW/4HANA Latest Version or earlier
* ABAP experience developing BADIs, BAPIs, Other ABAP and Front End (Excel) logic.
* To be hands on in business process reengineering, systems design, configuration and implementation of SAP BPC/ Outlook Soft solutions for a wide range of industries
* In-depth working experience with Financial Systems

title: SAP Success Factors Integration Architect
description:
Dear Candidate
 



  





 Greetings from Owision!
 



  





 We have an urgent position for 
 **SAP Successfactors Integration Architect** 
  in Stockholm, Sweden.
 



  





 Please find the details as below: 
 



  





**Job Position: SAP Success Factors Integration Architect** 




**Required Exp: 8+ yrs**

title: UX Designer - Infrastructure and DX
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a UX Designer for Infrastructure and Developer Experience to work with the exceptional engineering teams at Canonical and have a vital role in improving developer experience globally.
   

  

 Our design team is on a mission to turn complex, open-source software into efficient, intuitive products that can change how complex systems are built and what open source is capable of for enterprise IT. We are looking for a talented and technically minded user experience designer, who shares our ambitions.
   

  

 This role sits in the design team reporting to one of the Infrastructure and Developer Experience design managers or Director.
   

  

 Location:
 *This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.*
**The role entails**
* Building tools that enable everyone to build their own cloud experiences (MAAS, LXD, MicroCloud and Canonical k8s)
* Collaborating with product managers and engineers to shape the future of developer experience
* Supporting deeply complex products with the process of design and UX heuristics
* Working to evolve and evangelise design systems that drive consistency and efficiency
* Understanding the broader scope of your work and its numerous interconnected constraints
* Supporting one of our working groups to enable Canonical design's horizontal efforts


**What we are looking for in you**
* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Bachelor's or equivalent in User Experience, Design, or STEM or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
* Knowledge and passion for user experience, technology and design
* Commitment to continuous learning and improvement - curious, flexible, scientific
* Result-oriented with a drive to finish work and celebrate success
* Confidence in user research practices
* Engagement with the latest design research and innovation
* Ability to travel internationally twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long


 UX designers should be excellent communicators who are at ease working with a complex mix of engineers, designers and executives. They represent us at cross-functional company meetings and must present their design position with clarity and precision. They should be confident and excited to take on complex design challenges. They should also be able to connect their design leadership to the strategic vision of the company.
   

  

 Read more about the design team
   

  

**What we offer you**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
*We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products.* 
*Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration* 
*.*

title: Growth Operations Manager - Central Europe
job_function: Business Development, Marketing, and Product Management
description:
**Who We Are**
 At OKX, we believe that the future will be reshaped by crypto, and ultimately contribute to every individual's freedom.
   

  

 OKX is a leading crypto exchange, and the developer of OKX Wallet, giving millions access to crypto trading and decentralized crypto applications (dApps). OKX is also a trusted brand by hundreds of large institutions seeking access to crypto markets. We are safe and reliable, backed by our Proof of Reserves.
   

  

 Across our multiple offices globally, we are united by our core principles:
 *We Before Me* 
 ,
 *Do the Right Thing* 
 , and
 *Get Things Done* 
 . These shared values drive our culture, shape our processes, and foster a friendly, rewarding, and diverse environment for every OK-er.
   

  

 OKX is part of OKG, a group that brings the value of Blockchain to users around the world, through our leading products OKX, OKX Wallet, OKLink and more.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Act as the operational backbone of the Central European growth team, ensuring seamless collaboration between the Regional Manager and Sr. Growth Managers across different markets.
* Be the "right hand" of the Regional Manager to develop business strategies in alignment with team and company priorities.
* Support the execution of the company’s marketing and growth strategy, driving initiatives that align with business objectives. Channels include digital campaigns, PR, content marketing, SEO/SEM, and offline activations.
* Own ad-hoc requests and problem-solving tasks, proactively addressing roadblocks in execution and strategy implementation.
* Identify and track key metrics to measure the effectiveness of marketing efforts, analyze marketing performance data and synthesize insights into reports and presentations for the regional manager.
* Support strategic regional initiatives, assisting in the preparation of market analyses, competitive benchmarking, and growth roadmaps.
* Develop, implement and maintain operational processes in line with the business plan and strategy.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with internal stakeholders (product, legal, compliance, etc.) to ensure marketing initiatives are aligned with company priorities.


**What We Look For In You**
* Be hands-on, execution-oriented, willing, and able to drive the progress of existing projects as well as plan the delivery of new activities.
* Strong project management skills and a history of delivering on objectives.
* A track record of developing and implementing effective processes.
* Strong analytical skills, especially in a growth marketing context
* A proven ability to work between cross-functional teams, including a self starter mentality when it comes to picking up new concepts.
* Self-motivated, critical thinker and adept at working independently and in a dispersed team environment covering multiple and varied tasks.
* Strong communication and presentation skills in English, both verbal and written.
* Experience in Marketing/Growth in the FinTech industry
* A passion for crypto and digital assets


**Nice to Haves**
* Relevant experience in the fintech industry.
* Global exposure and cross-culture mindset.


**Perks & Benefits**
* Competitive total compensation package
* L&D programs and Education subsidy for employees' growth and development
* Various team building programs and company events
* More that we love to tell you along the process!

title: People Business Partner
company_industry: Real Estate, Leasing Non-residential Real Estate, and Construction
description:
Are you a self-propelled, skilled in labor law and a dedicated HR specialist? Do you want to continue to develop within HR in the retail property sector? Then this might be the right challenge for you!
 



  





 We put people at the heart of everything we do. We attract, engage and retain talent. We bolster a dynamic culture by evolving the way we work, and we drive our sustainable business transformation.
 



  





**Who are we** 




  





 Unibail-Rodamco-Westfield (URW) is driven by an entrepreneurial foundation of talented and ambitious employees who embrace change, strive for innovation, and know when to step into uncharted terrain. Teams within URW are collaborative and thrive by working together to seize opportunities and solve challenges. Employees receive mentorship and guidance while being empowered to drive their initiatives, embracing their individuality and unique backgrounds.
 



 URW‘s flagship destinations are interwoven into the community fabric, and we give employees the power to be impactful in their work and lead meaningful change in our communities through volunteering, DE&I programming, and leading ESG efforts. URW is an innovator and trendsetter in experiential entertainment and is making bold moves to be a brand that creates inspiring consumer experiences in-person and digitally. URW is surprising and delighting customers by reinventing being together and creating memorable moments.
 



  





 We are now seeking a talented individual to join our dynamic People department as a People Business Partner Nordics, based in Stockholm, Sweden. You will play a crucial role in fostering an open and cohesive working culture that embodies trust and professionalism. Reporting to Managing Director of People Northern Europe, you will be responsible for supporting 85 employees based in Sweden and Denmark, working closely with your Dutch counterparts and the Group People team in Uk and Paris.
 



  





 Our team is committed to providing the best possible working experience for our employees by delivering impeccable services. We proudly champion our annual Community Day, Be You networking initiatives, and URW for Jobs events. With employee engagement scores among the highest in the industry, we aim to set the standard in our business and lead beyond our region.
 



 The People Team, a relatively new group of five dedicated colleagues, operates from our Swedish, Dutch and UK offices as well as our assets. In the Nordic region, we manage several large shopping centers, including Westfield Mall of Scandinavia, Täby Centrum, Nacka Forum, and Fisketorvet in Copenhagen.
 



  





**What you will be doing** 




  




* Apply the People Strategy in all areas to match business goals.
* Work closely with all department leaders on People-related matters.
* Oversee all updates to HR policies and ensure they are updated in line with current employment law legislation.
* Coach and guide managers and support them during changes and negotiations.
* Manage annual talent and performance review process, including end-of-year reviews and 360 feedback. Liaise with the senior leadership team to develop departmental people plans and create yearly succession plans for all departments.
* Work with the Managing Director of People on the headcount forecasting and work with departmental leads to ensure business resource plan. Create business plans for resource planning.
* Plan and coordinate the People management activities to maximise the strategic use of people across each division.
* Work with the senior leadership team to deliver key employee survey messages and create value action plans with all departments.
* Manage People related projects.
* Support with Learning & Development initiatives for Northern Europe.
* Support the wider Northern Europe People team on the annual compensation review process.
* Stay updated on current and future People and Union laws that may affect the company.
* Help improve our People systems and practices with the Group People Team.
* Managing new employment onboarding and inductions.
* Deliver training throughout the year.



  





**What you will need to bring with you** 




  




* Bachelor’s degree in business administration or similar.
* You have between 5-10 years of professional experience in HR; developing and supporting managers, Nordic culture understanding, experience working in a change management/environment and from private sector.
* You have extensive experience of labor law (white collars) for Sweden and preferably Denmark.
* You have experience in an international environment and are used to working in a matrix organization.
* You prefer a structured approach and can make clear decisions for the team.
* You have relationship building skills and you are a team player.
* You have financial and analytical skills.
* You are a driven and responsible person taking ownership.



  





**Why join us?** 




  





 We provide an array of fantastic perks for our staff, including significant learning and development opportunities through professional qualifications, involvement in exciting business projects, and informal lunch & learns hosted by colleagues. Our company culture centres on caring for our employees and supporting their success. With diverse roles, you won't be limited to one area but have the chance to grow a broad range of skills and experiences. We also have other great perks, such as Health care allowance is 4500 SEK per year and 6 weeks’ vacation!
 



  





**Where you will work** 




  





 Our teams work in our head offices or our assets. The team is generally present in the office or in the assets. For this role, we expect that you will work from our head office in Stockholm and on the other days you will mainly work in our assets in Sweden and Copenhagen.
 



  





**Values & behaviours** 




  





 Our company purpose – to Reinvent Being Together – is to reimagine how individuals and communities come together, socialise, and enjoy dynamic experiences alongside one another in entirely new ways. Our values are the foundation of how we succeed together today, and how we will achieve together tomorrow.
 



  





 Unibail-Rodamco-Westfield is an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity of backgrounds, perspectives, experience, and skills. We stand against racism, discrimination, and bias of any kind. Diversity is vital to the success of our business, and we are committed to creating an environment of belonging.
 



  





 We welcome, embrace, and make the most of people’s individual differences, including race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, and other legally protected characteristics.
 



  





**Do you want to know more?** 




  





 In this process Unibail Rodamco Westfield is working with Level Recruitment. To apply, please click the apply button. If you have further questions don´t hesitate to contact senior recruitment consultant Sissel Strand at +46 8 120 50 426. We will interview ongoingly so please register your application in English as soon as possible.
 



  





**About the Company** 




  





 At Unibail-Rodamco-Westfield (URW), we are the owner, developer and operator of sustainable, high-quality real estate assets in the most dynamic cities in Europe and the United States. We operate 72 shopping centres in 12 countries, including 39 which carry the iconic Westfield brand. We are driven by the positive environmental, social and economic impact we can have on the cities and communities where we operate.
 



 URW Northen Europe is an international team of about 145 employees based in the Netherlands, Sweden and Denmark. We run a total of 7 assets like Westfield Mall of Scandinavia, Westfield Taby Centre, Nacka Shopping Centre and Fisketorvet in Copenhagen.
