title: IT-Supporttekniker
description:
**About This Role**
 Letar du efter en givande och utvecklande karriär inom IT? Vill du vidga dina vyer inom en växande högteknologiskt företag inom flyg-/tekniksektor?
   

  

 CAE har en spännande jobbmöjlighet för en serviceinriktad och driven person inom IT-support, baserad på CAE Training Centre i Stockholm, nära Arlanda flygplats.
   

  

 Detta är ett utmärkt tillfälle för en driven person att gå med i ett flerfaldigt prisbelönt företag som är världsledande inom sitt område. Vi erbjuder konkurrenskraftig lön och villkor, samt möjligheter att utvecklas och växa rollen.
   

  

**Om tjänsten:**
 Du är primärt ansvarig för leverans av första linjens interna IT-supportärenden (telefon, remote och på plats) för CAE-personalen lokalt, men även inom Europa. Du jobbar självständigt, men ingår och arbetar tätt samman med duktiga supporttekniker-kollegor i Norden och Europa. Du rapporterar till Core IT Group Leader (Storbritannien & Norden).
   

  

 Du kommer att få djupare kunskap inom olika operativsystem och tekniska plattformar inklusive Windows 11, Windows Server, SharePoint, Azure, Active Directory-hantering, Office 365-appar, ekonomi- och CRM-system och många andra.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter & Ansvarsområden
   

  

* Konfigurera, distribuera och installera företagets bärbara och stationära datorer, bildskärmar, headsets, dockningsstationer, skrivare, mobiltelefoner, hård- och mjukvara.
* Stödja cirka 100 användare med deras IT-frågor, tekniska problem och förfrågningar.
* On- och Offboarding av medarbetare, inklusive konfigurering av arbetsutrustning.
* Hantering och underhåll av lagerförd IT-utrustning och dess mjukvara.
* Logga ärenden och förfrågningar i IT Service Management-systemet (BMC Helix).
* Installering, konfigurering och felsökning av företagsapplikationer.
* Stöd MS Office-produkter (Office 365, Microsoft Teams), Windows 10/11 Enterprise och andra appar med hjälp av fjärråtkomst, samt personligen på plats.
* Stödja våra interna och externa kunder med att säkerställa fungerande teknisk utrustning i våra konferens- och klassrum .
* Delta i nya spännande projekt, implementering av nya mjuk- och hårdvarulösningar.
* Samarbeta med andra IT-team över hela världen.
* Installera och underhålla AV-utrustning inom utbildningscentret.
* Tjänsteresor till andra CAE-kontor kan förekomma vid behov.


**Din bakgrund och personliga egenskaper:**
* Ett par års erfarenhet av IT Support/Helpdesk roll eller liknande.
* Teknisk utbildning, IT-examen eller likvärdiga kunskaper/arbetslivserfarenheter.
* Goda kunsakaper om datorer, kringutrustning, operativsystem, nätverk och säkerhet.
* God analytisk och felsökningsförmåga med hjälp av logik och sökmotorer.
* God kommunikativ förmåga och pedagogisk tillvägagångssätt både skriftligt och muntligt.
* Självgående och serviceinriktad, med snabb inlärningsförmåga i en föränderlig miljö.
* Ser detaljer, har tålamod och förmågan att själv prioritera vid hög arbetsbelastning.
* Goda kunskaper i engelska och svenska, både i tal och skrift.


**Arbetsplats:**
* CAE Training Centre i Stockholm.
* Visst resande ingår i tjänsten.


**Vi erbjuder:**
* Konkurransmässiga löner.
* Kollektivavtalad tjänstepension och försäkringar.
* Hälsoförsäkring.
* Aktieköpsprogram för anställda.
* Friskvårdsförmån.


**Om anställningen:**
 Anställningen är en tillsvidare på heltid med inledande provanställning. Är du medborgare i ett land utanför EU/EES eller Schengen behöver du uppvisa uppehålls- & arbetstillstånd.
   

  

 Vi tillämpar individuell lönesättning och bakgrundskontroller på alla nyanställningar.
   

  

 Urval av kandidater sker löpande. Vi ser gärna att du startar så snart som möjligt.
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
**About Us**
 At CAE, we exist to make the world safer. Our cutting-edge training and critical operations solutions empower pilots, airlines, defence and security forces to perform at their best every day and when the stakes are the highest. We equip those in critical roles with the skills and expertise needed to move our world forward safely.
   

  

 Our teams assure the success of our partners across civil aviation and defence and security. We’re proud to be the partner of choice for those operating in the most complex environments. Around the globe, we’re everywhere customers need us to be. We digitalize the physical world, deploying simulation training and operations-support solutions
   

  

 CAE represents 75 years of industry firsts—the highest-fidelity flight and mission simulators and personalized training programs powered by AI. That innovative mindset continues to define our work today, fuelling our promise to engineer better solutions that maximize value for those we serve. It’s our collaborative and proactively agile employees who make this pursuit of “better” possible. Together, our ethos and our people produce the technological advancements that enable our clients to decisively achieve difficult goals.
   

  

**Position Type**
 Regular
   

  

 CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 CAE is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. As "One CAE," we take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants regardless of race, nationality, colour, religion, sex, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, neurodiversity, Veteran status, age, or other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 If you don't see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed in the job posting, we still encourage you to reach out and apply. At CAE, everyone is welcome to contribute to our success. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please get in touch with us at rh-hr@cae.com.
   

  

**110986**

title: VP – Global Mobile Network Operators
description:
**Job Description**
**Role:**
 VP – Global Mobile Network Operators
   

  

**Country**
 International (Location: Open)
   

  

**Background**
 The Global Tech & Durables team is responsible for defining the go to market approach for our suite of sales measurement and consumer insight solutions. Supporting our Account Management teams across 60 countries to maximize our reach and value to clients, whilst achieving defined commercial and sales targets. The VP Global Mobile Network Operators owns our data relationships, propositions and commercial targets for the vertical. The role is focused on driving Global standards and broadening our relationships with Telecom Operators, whilst being the figurehead for the company within the Industry.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Global Sales Strategy and Target Ownership. Assume global responsibility for the sales plan and targets of Telecom Operators. Define and lead strategic business initiatives to achieve these targets.
* Business Growth. Accountable for high-value pitches for prospective Telecom Operator clients. Provide hands-on support to ensure that our solutions effectively meet client requirements and are clearly communicated.
* Commercial Excellence. Promote commercial excellence by consistently promotion and implementing best practices across the community of Telecom Operator Account Managers.
* Partner Program Management. Oversee the Partner Program for Mobile Network Operators (MNOs) and Mobile Virtual Network Operators (MVNOs). Ensure the program meets data requirements and commercial expectations and maintain it to reflect current business needs.
* New Partnership Development. Secure new partnerships with Telecom Operators. Identify and address data gaps, and develop and implement a defined data sourcing strategy that drives mutual growth and enhances decision-making processes.
* Internal Training and Empowerment. Develop and deliver relevant and impactful internal training programs to empower Telecom Operator Account Managers with a deep understanding of industry trends and business requirements.
* Client Value. Collaborate with the community of Telecom Operator Account Managers to ensure that current and future clients derive maximum value from their partnership with NIQ-GfK.
* Thought Leadership and Consultancy. Establish thought leadership and provide strategic consultancy services to Telecom Operators. Collaborate with the Marketing team to develop and execute annual marketing plans that engage Telecom Operator clients and address their insight needs.
* Industry Ambassador. Serve as an ambassador for the Telecom Operator vertical at key industry events, including Mobile World Congress. Enhance the NIQ-GfK brand value and develop the existing client network within the industry.
* Industry Needs. Develop and leverage a network within Telecom Operators to understand their insight needs. Identify opportunities to support clients with new globally scaled solutions.
* Insight Solutions. Work with the product, tech, and operations teams to develop solution roadmaps that best address the needs of Telecom Operator clients. Ensure the client's voice is reflected in the decision-making process.


**Essential Skills And Expectations**
* Ownership of Global business unit with understanding of how to move sales organization at scale
* Client focused. Proficient in identifying, exploring and communicating client needs, converting into appropriate GfK research solutions that enable client growth.
* Deep understanding of Telecom Operators, their business model & how they use data for decisions
* Experience in achieving new business development
* Strong communication skills. Knows how to engage with individuals across a broad spectrum of backgrounds and roles to meet common goal.
* Ability to use data to diagnose problems, identify and implement scalable corrective actions.
* Able to build meaningful client relationships, and work standalone
* Thinks outside the box and challenges where necessary.
* Passion, energy and drive.


**Desired Experience**
* Minimum 10 years in a sales role in the telecoms industry
* Direct line management experience with track record of driving team performance to meet and exceed company targets.
* Proven track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets in a competitive environment
* Experience in leading and managing complex sales cycles, including negotiations with senior executives
* Expertise in developing and executing go-to-market strategies for telecom products or solutions
* Strong network within the telecom industry, including relationships with key decision-makers at major Telecom Operators


**Additional Information**
**Our Benefits**
* Flexible working environment
* Volunteer time off
* LinkedIn Learning
* Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


**About NIQ**
 NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.
   

  

 For more information, visit NIQ.com
   

  

 Want to keep up with our latest updates?
   

  

 Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook
   

  

**Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion**
 NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

title: Tech Lead (iGaming)
description:
We're looking for a Technical Lead, Creative Director or Studio Manager based in Stockholm, with extensive iGaming experience.
 



  





**Please note: Applicants without iGaming experience will not be considered.** 




  





**Please note: Applicants who cannot work onsite 5 days a week will not be considered.** 




  





**About the company** 




 This startup game studio are co-owned by a big player in the iGaming industry. As such, they have a startup feel, but financial backing from an industry giant. They also have access to a very strong distribution network. They are a small and growing team full of talented industry experts.
 



  





**Job description** 




 You'll oversee a team of creatives (Artists, Animators, Developers etc), taking ownership othe slot game development process - making sure each game is exciting and memorable.
 



  





**The Offer** 



* Working at an exciting startup in an early phase of their growth
* Working alongside a team of industry superstars
* A growing company with progression opportunities
* Financially stable company who are backed by an industry heavyweight
* A quality Stockholm office space
* Healthcare budget
* Salary level of between SEK 50k and SEK 65k pm (roughly)



  





 Apply now if you would be interested in joining an exciting slot game studio startup and feel you can contribute towards the next step of their growth!

title: DevOps Cloud Engineer
description:
Who We Are Looking For
   

  

 We are looking for a DevOps Cloud Engineer with 5 years of experience in infrastructure engineering, cloud environments, and possessing high technical skills along with an 'automation first' mindset. You are someone who is proactive with a strong sense of ownership and responsibility, eager to learn, and keen to share knowledge. Experience with building continuous integration and deployment pipelines on cloud platforms is required, along with excellent communication skills.
   

  

 What is Dev-IT
   

  

 You will be working in a small (but growing) team that is providing infrastructure and services to almost every part of the business. Be it from smaller automations to big implementations or development.
   

  

 What you will do
   

  

  

* Build automations for creating new services and integrations for many departments within the company.
* Play an important part of the team, managing the infrastructure of AWS.
* Manage and develop our containers, instances as well as serverless environments.


 Your profile
   

  

**Required Experience**
* Advanced knowledge and hands-on experience with AWS (other public clouds such as Azure and GCP are a plus)
* Experience in working with container technology (ECS, EKS / Kubernetes).
* Advanced experience within scripting languages such as Python, Bash and PowerShell.
* Managed and configured pipelines within Continuous Integration Solutions Azure DevOps / Jira.
* Administrated version control systems like Git, GitHub.
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation and Ansible.
* Identity management and SSO integrations, OAuth, SAML.


**Nice To Have Qualifications**
* Windows and/or Linux sysop background
* ETL knowledge
* Grafana
* VMWare (or similar solutions)


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySeach is the driving force behind our organization
 **, where** 
 everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability
 **to deliver** 
 exceptional results,
 **pay** 
 close attention to detail, and consistently
 **go** 
 the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in
 **their** 
 field
 **, driven by** 
 a relentless focus on solving problems
 **-** 
 no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in
 **leading the way in** 
 cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative
 **solutions** 
 that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Please apply to the position through the application form below. Selection and interviews will be ongoing. We do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: Open Application - Software Engineer - Lime Go
description:
**We’re always excited to meet talented individuals. While this position isn’t currently open, we welcome the opportunity to connect with outstanding candidates for future possibilities.**
**Please note:** 
 We promise to review your application, but will only reach out to you if we find a potential match.
   

  

**A Scaleup Journey & Entrepreneurial Environment!**
 Join Lime Go, a scaleup business unit within Lime Technologies Sweden AB (publ). This is your chance to be part of a fast-moving, ambitious team while enjoying the stability and success of a publicly listed company.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 At
 **Lime Go** 
 , software is at the core of our business. Our engineers work closely with product managers and designers to shape the future of our product. We believe in
 **ownership, pragmatism, and long-term thinking** 
 , focusing on building clean, maintainable, and scalable solutions.
   

  

 We work in
 **cross-functional teams (5-7 people),** 
 making decisions together, iterating fast, and having a great time while doing it. We follow
 **Shape Up** 
 as our development methodology—think of it as Scrum, but better. 😉
   

  

**The Role**
 We’re looking for a
 **Software Engineer** 
 who is
 **strong on the JavaScript/React side** 
 while being comfortable working across the stack with .NET. If you love crafting
 **delightful front-end experiences** 
 while understanding the backend logic that powers them, this role is for you.
   

  

**The Product?** 
 🤑
   

  

 Lime Go is a Data Enriched Sales CRM for SMBs in the Nordics. With 1000 customers in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark, we’re aiming to expand throughout Europe. We're on the path of becoming the most most user-friendly and powerful Sales CRM for growing B2B companies in Europe.
   

  

**What’s the Journey?** 
 🚀
   

  

 We’re a team of 20 people, laser-focused on aggressive growth. Join us and be part of our scaleup journey!
   

  

**Requirements**
**Skills & Requirements**
* Big passion for code - loves to reason and think about code
* Strong collaboration skills Analytical mindset, always aiming for simple solutions to complex problems
* More than five years of professional working experience as a Software Engineer
* You are comfortable working with React (and .Net) and JS based applications.
* Excellent oral, written, and English communication skills
* Being able to plan your work and use/apply agile ceremonies (standups, retros, etc.)


**Nice to have**
* Experience in running/hosting software in production environments.
* Experience in SaaS, startups, or scaleups.
* Experience working with Octopus Deploy platform.
* Experience working with Docker.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field.


**Benefits & Perks?** 
 💸
   

  

* Generous employee perks and benefits: collective agreement, company conferences and parties, 6 weeks vacation, pension, monthly pubs, merch, wellness allowance, and more
* Tons of team activities and laughs along the way!


 Let’s Go!
