title: System Administrator
description:
About Us
  
We are an innovation-driven IT product and consulting company committed to providing high-quality solutions and consultants.
  
At Luday AB, our primary objective is to deliver services of the highest quality. We take the time to fully understand the requirements of each client before creating software solutions or providing consulting resources specifically suited to their needs. To help our clients maximize the value of their software solutions, we also offer ongoing support and maintenance.
  
About You
  
We are seeking an experienced System Administrator with development skills and a strong passion for DevOps, Observability, and Security. This is an on-site role at our office in Göteborg, Sweden.
  
In this role, you will help bridge the gap between traditional system administration and software development support. You will play a key role in building and maintaining an observability solution that spans from development environments to support and operations instances. Key responsibilities include managing infrastructure, creating dashboards, handling release processes, and supporting teams and users of the observability stack.
  
Since our teams follow a Secure Development Lifecycle (SDLC) practice, awareness and compliance with security standards are essential.
  
We are looking for an active learner with strong communication skills who enjoys working in a collaborative team environment. Our vision is to build robust and user-friendly solutions that benefit delivery teams, operations staff, and airline end users.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Work collaboratively as a team player with a self-driven and quality-focused mindset.
  
Drive DevOps culture and promote Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) practices.
  
Develop and configure software for seamless integration of multiple products.
  
Deploy systems and install products in target environments.
  
Support system verification and product release handling (governance/QA).
  
  

**Basic Qualifications (Required Skills & Experience):**  

**Experience with cloud infrastructure tools:** Kubernetes, Consul, Vault.
  
**Hands-on experience with cloud platforms and security:** AWS or Azure.
  
**Proficiency in Infrastructure as Code (IaC):** Ansible, Terraform.
  
**Strong understanding of Observability tools and concepts:** Prometheus, Loki, Grafana.
  
Expertise in Linux operating systems, particularly Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL).
  
Proven experience in system setup, maintenance, and monitoring.
  
Proficiency in one or more programming languages.
  
Experience with continuous integration (CI/CD) using GitLab CI.
  
Strong knowledge of version control systems (Git).
  
Fluency in English, both written and spoken.
  
  

**Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills & Experience):**  

Degree in Computer Science or equivalent professional experience.
  
Programming expertise in Python, Java, or Shell scripting (sh/bash).
  
Knowledge of networking principles (TCP/IP, firewalls, protocols).
  
Experience with Technical Configuration Management (YAML, JSON).
  
Familiarity with identity management solutions (OIDC, SAML).

title: Consultant Job - Head of Data
description:
Do you dream of transforming raw data into actionable insights? Are you a visionary leader with a passion for building and scaling data platforms? Blue Lobster is searching for a dynamic Head of Data to revolutionize our data-driven decision-making. If you're ready to make a significant impact in a fast-paced, innovative environment, this is your chance!

**About the role:**


As Head of Data, you'll be the architect of our data strategy. You will lead a talented team, driving the evolution of our data warehouse platform and fostering a data-centric culture across the organization. This role offers the perfect blend of technical expertise, leadership skills, and strategic thinking.

**Your responsibilities will include:**

* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and define data needs
* Managing a complex data warehouse environment, prioritizing scalability and cross-functional integration
* Leveraging your deep expertise in our tech stack (Snowflake, dbt, Stitch, Power BI) to drive innovation
* Leading the development of data models, ELT/ETL processes, and insightful visualizations
* Championing DevOps best practices to optimize data workflows (CI/CD, Git, Jira)
* Maintaining the existing data warehouse platform while spearheading its future vision
* Guiding a high-performing team, prioritizing tasks, and maximizing productivity
* Implementing and overseeing data governance and security policies across our global enterprise, ensuring compliance and data integrity
* Communicating effectively with stakeholders at all levels, demystifying complex data concepts, and fostering buy-in for data initiatives
* Embracing a flexible, hybrid work model with occasional travel within Europe

**Qualifications:**

* Proven track record of gathering requirements and managing data warehouses in large, complex organizations, focusing on scalability and integration
* In-depth expertise in our tech stack (Snowflake, dbt, Stitch, Power BI)
* Extensive experience leading the development of data models, ELT/ETL processes, and impactful data visualizations
* Solid understanding of DevOps principles, including CI/CD, Git, and Agile methodologies (e.g., Jira)
* Ability to maintain and evolve a data warehouse platform, driving its future vision
* Demonstrated leadership skills, with the ability to manage small, efficient teams, prioritize tasks, and boost productivity
* Knowledge of implementing and monitoring data governance and security policies across a global organization, ensuring compliance and data integrity
* Excellent communication skills, enabling you to interact effectively with diverse stakeholders, explain intricate data concepts clearly, and drive change
* Fluency in English

**Preferred skills:**

* DBT
* GitHub
* Python
* Snowflake
* SQL

**What we offer:**

  

* Opportunities for professional growth and development
* A competitive compensation and benefits package

**About Blue Lobster AB:**


Blue Lobster is a consultancy that puts its consultants first. We are a company with the highest creditworthiness and a quality focus that permeates the entire business, which is proven by our ISO certifications in 9001 (quality), 14001 (environment) and 27001 (information security). No matter where you live in Sweden, we have exciting projects waiting for you. We focus on long-term relationships and give you the opportunity to grow with us.

**Application:**


Ready to dive into the world of data with Blue Lobster? Apply today! We look forward to hearing from you. Please indicate in your application that you are interested in the Head of Data position.

title: Embedded Platform Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**  

* Configure, maintain and deploy Yocto-based Linux platform including BSP, drivers, and system services.
* Integrate and optimize an open-source management platform with secure APIs.
* Establish secure communication (TLS, certificate management) over industrial protocols (CAN, MODBUS, MQTT, HTTPS etc.).
* Maintain cloud connectivity, IoT security, and OTA update mechanisms.
* Design and manage the CI/CD pipeline to streamline deployment and application integration.

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* Embedded Linux (Yocto, BSP, driver integration, security hardening)
* ARM-based platforms, networking
* Cloud & IoT (MQTT, TLS, secure OTA updates)
* Industrial communication protocols (CAN, MODBUS, API integration)
* CI/CD, automated build systems, developer enablement

  

**Application deadline:** 13-02-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!  

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**

title: QA Engineer
description:
**QA Engineer for the consumer loan segment**


We are on the lookout for a driven and motivated QA engineer to strengthen our team that develops and maintains the bank’s digital services in the consumer lending segment. In this role you will work with the application flow system supporting multiple European countries.


As a QA engineer with us, you'll be the guardian of quality, ensuring that our software meets business requirements and banking standards. You will be an integral part of our collaborative team, working hand-in-hand with developers, team leads, business analysts and delivery managers to drive innovation at every stage of the development life cycle.


We're looking for someone with a sharp eye for details and a passion for teamwork. Your mission? To keep our developers on their toes, uncovering defects they never even knew existed.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Close cooperation with business, product owner and developers to understand requirements
* Plan test activities both for functional and non-functional requirements
* Conduct various types of testing such as functional, regression, performance and security
* Cooperate with developers on defects and improvements
* Create and execute test cases to identify defects, ensuring that the final product is reliable, user-friendly, and meets the specified requirements.
* Execute test cases both via exploratory testing as well as using automated testing tools to help identify and report defects
* Support in user acceptance testing
* Writing and maintaining test documentation
* Log and track defects

**Qualifications and Experience:**

* B.Sc. or Master’s degree in Computer Science or other relevant field.
* Minimum 3 years of experience as QA conducting various test methods like unit, integration, performance, etc.
* Backend and Frontend testing.
* Experience in testing frameworks and tools.
* Proficient in English (B2 level).

 **Skills:**

* Rest API Testing with Postman or similar tool.
* Test Automation with Selenium or similar tool.
* Practical knowledge of .NET/C# and SQL is required.
* Azure DevOps.
* Practical knowledge and understanding of Agile methodologies.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Good communication skills.
* Understanding of banking systems and related standards is a merit.

title: Embedded Software Application Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**  

* Design, develop and maintain software applications using Embedded C, C#, and C++
* Utilize Adaptive Autosar frameworks to enhance software functionality
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and test software solutions
* Work with Linux OS to develop and deploy applications.
* Troubleshoot and debug software issues to ensure optimal performance.
* Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to peers.
* Verification at all levels to ensure software quality through code reviews, unit testing, HIL, SIL and debugging.
* Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies to continuously improve skills and knowledge.

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Proficiency in Embedded C, C#, and C++.
* Proficiency in Autosar.
* Experience with Linux OS.
* Knowledge of both Adaptive Autosar and classic Autosar is a must.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
* Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies.

  

**Application deadline:** 18-02-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

title: Senior Testledare
description:
För att möta marknadens efterfrågan söker vi just nu en erfaren testledare till vårt härliga gäng i teamet Great IT Active Malmö.

 **Rollen vi söker:**

  

Vi söker dig som har **mer än 5 års** erfarenhet av testledning och kvalitetssäkring. Har arbetat i flera olika projekt samt har ett genuint intresse av området.

  

Kvalifikationer:

  

* Erfarenhet av att **leda** testteam i en **coachande** roll för att lyfta fram, stötta och hjälpa andra att lyckas i sitt arbete och i att prestera på topp.
* Erfarenhet av att ta fram **testplaner,** **teststrategier** och kunskap för att kunna tillämpa rätt **testmetod** för uppgiften.
* Kunskap om **rapportering** och **dokumentation**, för att hålla intressenter kontinuerligt uppdaterade om progress men också slutrapportering.
* Erfarenhet av **agila arbetssätt** så som Scrum, Lean och SAFe
* Erfarenhet och kunskap om **verktyg** så som Jira, Azure DevOps, ReqTest, MS Office med flera.
* Grundläggande **teknisk kompetens** och har förmågan att sätta dig in i komplexa IT-lösningar och system och kan på ett obehindrat sätt kommunicera och föra en dialog med utvecklingsteam.
* Utmärkta **kommunikations- och sociala färdigheter** och både talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska och engelska.
* Relevanta **certifieringar,** till exempel ISTQB eller inom Scrum.

**Vem är du?**


Vi tror att du, precis som vi, kan skriva under på våra tre värdeord, **driv**, **mod** och **engagemang** och är en person med hjärtat på rätt ställe som sträcker ut en hand till en kollega när hen behöver hjälp och tycker det är viktigt att bidra på jobbet och ha kul tillsammans med kollegor. Vi tror att du vill vara med och växa med oss och bidra med din kompetens och person så att vi fortsätter leverera som vi heter, Great!

  

Rollen som konsult hos oss kan innebära mycket men en framgångsfaktor för att lyckas kommer vara din personlighet.

 **Vilka är vi?**

  

Great IT är ett av de snabbast växande företagen inom IT-branschen som blivit framgångsrika då vi som företag inser att vår största framgång och tillgång utan tvekan kan tillskrivas våra fantastiska medarbetare, som hjälper oss att bygga Great IT till vad det är idag och vad det kan bli i framtiden. Vi sätter relationen till dig som medarbetare i första rummet för när du trivs på jobbet vet vi att våra kunder trivs med dig och oss.


Som IT-leverantör är vi duktiga på att anpassa oss efter marknaden. Vi vill erbjuda en arbetsplats där varje individ får möjlighet att utvecklas och växa inom sitt expertområde. Vi värdesätter en öppen och transparent kultur som bjuder in till gemenskap och samvaro. Vi är lyhörda och snabbfotade, där våra medarbetares åsikter och förslag blir uppmuntrade och anammade. Att vi på riktigt gillar att umgås och ha roligt tillsammans reflekteras i våra gemensamma aktiviteter och resor, både under och utanför arbetstid.


Genom vår företagskultur och våra värdeord (***Mod****,* ***Driv*** *och* ***Engagemang***) som uppmuntrar till samarbete och gemensamma leveranser, skapar vi en stark sammanhållning, levande atmosfär och god gruppdynamik. Något som våra medarbetare sammanfattar med orden: Gött gäng = Gött häng  

  

**Vi erbjuder**


Vi är glada att kunna erbjuda alla våra konsulter en unik uppdragsmatchning, då vi har tillgång till en fantastisk välutvecklad plattform där just dina specialistkompetenser, erfarenheter och uppdragsönskemål matchas mot våra kunders behov. Det gör att vi har **en hög träffsäkerhet att hitta det där uppdraget du letar efter! Lägg där till ett starkt nätverk som ger oss möjligheter ingen annan har.**Visst låter det spännande!


Våra medarbetare är det viktigaste för oss det gör att vi arbetar hårt för att vi alla ska ha det bästa. En trygg arbetsplats, bra lön, roliga uppdrag, fina förmåner, och balans mellan arbete och fritid. Här kommer ett axplock av vad vi erbjuder:

* Våra värderingar är viktiga och vi jobbar kontinuerligt med vår företagskultur
* Våra ledare har ett nära och kommunikativt samarbete med medarbetaren
* Frivillig hälsoundersökning finns
* Tjänstepension med individuell rådgivning
* Sjuk-, olycksfall- och livförsäkring
* Olika “flavors” av rabatter
* Maximalt friskvårdsbelopp
* Terminalglasögon
* Hybrid arbetsplats
* Roliga aktiviteter, konferenser och resor
Kamratlig och hjälpsam företagskultur: Great People - Great Together  
* 

  

Låter detta som något för dig? Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!


Vi granskar inkomna ansökningar löpande.

title: DevOps Engineer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
Our client is a prominent Scandinavian technology consultancy and Microsoft Top Tier Partner. The business specialises in services that help large-scale organizations streamline and secure their software development processes and digital efforts through a full range of managed software products and consulting services. We are now looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer top join their busy, growing, and highly successful team.
 



  





**Senior DevOps Engineer** 




  





**Stockholm, hybrid working from home.** 




  





**55- 65K SEK per month plus pension, insurances and excellent benefits package.** 




  





**To be successful in this role:** 




 You will be a confident and senior DevOps Engineer with 4+ years of experience in Cloud DevOps or platform engineering and strong hands-on experience with Kubernetes and Cloud Services (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
 



  





 Other requirements for this role include:
 


* Experience with CI/CD tools and automation (Terraform, Helm, ArgoCD)
* Solid understanding of cloud security and scalability practices
* Proficiency in English and Swedish
* Valid working visa or Swedish citizenship



  





**Position summary:** 




 Our client is an innovative and forward-thinking technology company that offers a lot of growth opportunity, hackathons, social events, a great package and a leadership that is genuinely caring, supporting and highly responsive! This role will be perfect for a cloud expert who thrives on innovation and collaboration in a dynamic, high-trust environment.
 



  





**Job role and responsibilities:** 




 As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you will build critical cloud systems which are utilized by users in multiple sectors. Your focus will be on cloud infrastructure, automation, and container orchestration. You will utilise and implement Kubernetes and cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GC, driving operational excellence and platform reliability.
 



  





 Key responsibilities for this role include:
 


* Design and manage scalable cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP)
* Implement Kubernetes-based solutions and container orchestration
* Automate deployments and manage CI/CD pipelines (Terraform, Azure DevOps)
* Ensure platform reliability, security, and performance optimization
* Collaborate closely with product and platform teams to drive automation and innovation



  





**Benefits:** 




 Extensive salary package based on experience
 



 Pension, health insurance, health benefits and more
 



 Remote/hybrid working options, flexibility
 



 Regular hackathons and knowledge-sharing labs
 



 Continuous learning, growth, and certification opportunities
 



 Trust-based, collaborative work environment

title: DevOps Engineer with Event-Driven Architecture Expertise
description:
**Job Description**
 If taking H&M’s integration platform to its next level excites you, then this opportunity is for you! The Event and Integration Services team is looking for an experienced DevOps engineer with a strong focus on working with Kafka. In this role, you will engage with a diverse and innovative integration ecosystem, collaborating with a highly skilled team that maintains various central integration platforms at H&M. You will see the big picture, identify patterns, and instinctively know how to win support for your ideas. Partnering with different teams and areas, you will support our Unit in driving the Integration Platforms & Services mission and roadmap. You will build and configure Kafka solutions that are easy to maintain and adapt, regardless of tools or languages. Believing in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust, you will work with a focus on value creation, growth, and serving customers with full ownership and accountability. Join our high-performance team and constantly improve the experience of our end users.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Strong experience in software engineering with focus on event streaming platforms such as Kafka and Solace.
* Worked with Event-driven Architecture and knowledge of how to implement this on a large scale in an Enterprise.
* Deep understanding of CI/CD automation for platform onboarding and self-service capabilities
* Deep knowledge of public cloud technologies (Azure & GCP primary)
* Strong agile mindset and skilled in planning, prioritizing, execution, and follow ups with cross functional teams.
* Develop and maintain event-driven architecture using platforms like Solace and Kafka.
* Ensure high quality of developed technical solutions
* Evaluate new platforms and features and work on proof of concepts and prototypes
* Deliver on time, demonstrating a strong commitment to deliver on the team mission and agreed backlog
* Create knowledge and produce the necessary documentation


**Qualifications**
* 10+ years of overall experience with 5+ years of experience working as a DevOps Engineer
* Deep understanding of Event-Driven Architecture principles.
* Substantial experience with version control software (Azure DevOps, Github etc.)
* Extensive hands-on experience with event platforms such as Solace and Kafka.
* Strong scripting skills (Powershell, Bash, or similar).
* Proficiency in scripting and automation using tools such as Terraform, Ansible, or similar.
* Extensive experience with the Microsoft Azure platform especially working with Azure storage, Event grid.
* Experience with a sprint-based agile way of working and knowledge of tools like Jira, confluence, ServiceNow
* Knowledge and experience working with performance testing methodologies and tools


**Additional Information**
 This is a
 **fulltime permanent position** 
 , starting as soon as possible according to agreement. The role is an on-site position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible, but no later than the
 **28th of February** 
 . Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Company Overview**
 Metrea is a defense company dedicated to translating commercial innovation into solutions for the hardest problems in national security. With deep mission expertise, Metrea focuses on delivering effects as-a-service across a spectrum of domains including Air & Space, Electromagnetic & Cyber, and Synthetic. Metrea Management provides central services to eleven (11) global capability units via Operations, Solutions, Strategy, Legal, and Finance teams
   

  

**Capability Unit Overview**
 Metrea Simulations (MSIM), redefines the cutting edge of flight simulation and services. Our expertise in physics, engineering and artistry allows us to leverage modern technologies in new and unprecedented ways in order to create the most realistic and immersive flight simulation training products and experiences possible. Through our technologies, customers enjoy an optimal path to efficient training, design, technology development and tactical analysis across the aviation sector. Our technology nucleus of advanced AI, flight and sensor modeling enables us to augment reality through the lens of next-generation products and services.
   

  

**Position Summary**
 We are seeking an experienced DevOps Engineer to join our development team. In this role, you will be responsible for creating, maintaining, and optimizing our build infrastructure and pipeline. You will work with Unreal Engine and Perforce to streamline the development process and implement automation to increase efficiency and reduce errors.
   

  

 This role requires a detail-oriented individual who can thrive in a fast-paced environment, communicate effectively with various teams, and continuously improve processes. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in build engineering, with specific experience in Perforce and Unreal Engine environments.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
* Design, implement, and maintain the build system and continuous integration pipeline for our Unreal Engine based simulator
* Manage and optimize our Perforce version control system
* Create and maintain build scripts
* Set up and maintain build servers, agent machines, and related network infrastructure
* Implement automation tools to improve efficiency and reduce manual processes
* Troubleshoot build failures and assist developers in resolving integration issues
* Collaborate with different teams to ensure smooth integration of assets and code
* Continuously monitor and improve build times and resource utilization
* Maintain and configure infrastructure across both public cloud and on-premise environments, including Windows and Linux servers.


**Skills And Experience**
* Strong programming skills, particularly in scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell)
* Extensive experience with Perforce
* Experience with Unreal Engine build processes and project structures
* Familiarity with continuous integration and deployment tools (e.g., Jenkins, TeamCity)
* Understanding of software development lifecycles and best practices
* Experience in setting up and managing Windows and Linux infrastructure, including virtual machines and containerization


**Additional Eligibility Qualifications**
* Experience in PC game development or related fields
* Experience working with IAC configuration management tools like Ansible, Chef, or Puppet.
* Experience with cloud services (e.g., AWS, Azure)

**Our Culture**
 Metrea’s single core value, “rooted in humility,” is supported by four key attributes: entrepreneurial, systematic, discerning, and over-deliver. These attributes, combined, form our Teammate Firmware, our culture. We explore these attributes during the hiring process when we grow our teams and continually support the growth of our culture. We are a hyper-collaborative, dynamically hierarchical organization united by a passion for what we do, how we do it, who we do it with, and who we do it for.
   

  

**Right to Work**

**Equal Opportunities Statement**
 Metrea Management Limited (MAM) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or other characteristics protected by law.
   

  

**Position Type and Expected Hours of Work**
 This is a full-time (40hrs/week) position.
   

  

**Work Location**
 Stockholm – Hybrid remote
   

  

**Work Environment** 
 This job operates in an office setting
   

  

**Travel**
 The role will require occasional travels

title: DevOps Engineer with Kafka and Event-Driven Architecture Expertise
description:
**Job Description**
 If taking H&M’s integration platform to its next level excites you, then this opportunity is for you! The Event and Integration Services team is looking for an experienced DevOps engineer with a strong focus on working with Kafka. In this role, you will engage with a diverse and innovative integration ecosystem, collaborating with a highly skilled team that maintains various central integration platforms at H&M. You will see the big picture, identify patterns, and instinctively know how to win support for your ideas. Partnering with different teams and areas, you will support our Unit in driving the Integration Platforms & Services mission and roadmap. You will build and configure Kafka solutions that are easy to maintain and adapt, regardless of tools or languages. Believing in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust, you will work with a focus on value creation, growth, and serving customers with full ownership and accountability. Join our high-performance team and constantly improve the experience of our end users.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Strong experience in software engineering with focus on event streaming platforms such as Kafka and Solace.
* Worked with Event-driven Architecture and knowledge of how to implement this on a large scale in an Enterprise.
* Deep understanding of CI/CD automation for platform onboarding and self-service capabilities
* Deep knowledge of public cloud technologies (Azure & GCP primary)
* Strong agile mindset and skilled in planning, prioritizing, execution, and follow ups with cross functional teams.
* Develop and maintain event-driven architecture using platforms like Solace and Kafka.
* Ensure high quality of developed technical solutions
* Evaluate new platforms and features and work on proof of concepts and prototypes
* Deliver on time, demonstrating a strong commitment to deliver on the team mission and agreed backlog
* Create knowledge and produce the necessary documentation


**Qualifications**
* 10+ years of overall experience with 5+ years of experience working as a DevOps Engineer
* Deep understanding of Event-Driven Architecture principles.
* Substantial experience with version control software (Azure DevOps, Github etc.)
* Extensive hands-on experience with event platforms such as Solace and Kafka.
* Strong scripting skills (Powershell, Bash, or similar).
* Proficiency in scripting and automation using tools such as Terraform, Ansible, or similar.
* Extensive experience with the Microsoft Azure platform especially working with Azure storage, Event grid.
* Experience with a sprint-based agile way of working and knowledge of tools like Jira, confluence, ServiceNow
* Knowledge and experience working with performance testing methodologies and tools


**Additional Information**
 This is a
 **fulltime permanent position** 
 , starting as soon as possible according to agreement. The role is an on-site position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible, but no later than the
 **28 th of February** 
 . Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.

title: Platform Engineer
description:
**We’re looking for an ambitious Platform Engineer to join our team.** 




  





 Are you inspired to build scalable systems that accelerate breakthrough technologies? ✨
 



  





 We are a fast-growing Stockholm-based startup with a team of 6, working on a cutting-edge creative product with AI at its core. We believe machine learning and AI are about to redefine what it means to be a creative, who can be part of a creative process and that creativity and AI are a uniquely powerful combination and an incredibly exciting field work in. We pride ourselves on our ability to rapidly adopt new developments, stay curious, and adapt quickly to changing circumstances.
 



  





**In this role you will** 



* Architect, develop, and maintain a scalable, secure, and high-performance platform.
* Improve the platform’s developer experience to empower product engineers to build more sophisticated features faster.
* Embody a culture of engineering excellence with high code quality standards.
* Set up infrastructure for deploying state of the art machine learning models to high performance GPU environments.
* Implement and maintain robust security practices to protect our platform and user privacy.
* Refine monitoring systems to track service performance, uptime, and key metrics.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers and engineers, to help shape the direction of our product.



  





**In your first** 




 Week
 


* Set up your local environment and make a small quality of life improvement along the way.
* Get familiar with the product, make some art!
* Ship at least a bug fix and/or a small feature to production.



 3 months
 


* Make significant improvements to our backend infrastructure.
* Ship numerous end-user facing features.
* Make testing and deploying new machine learning models faster and at lower cost.
* Make a serious dent on our technical debt, be it key technology choices or broken windows.



 6 months
 


* Become the go-to expert for all platform development.
* Continuously improve the platform while aligning with the product goals.
* Elevate our coding practices by mentoring peers and setting high standards for code quality and reviews.
* Maintain a robust monitoring system and security protocols including an on-call rota.



  





**You'll be a great fit if** 




 Requirements
 


* 5+ years of experience working as a backend/full-stack engineer in fast-paced environments.
* Strongly proficient in TypeScript and open to Python and Rust when appropriate.
* Hands-on experience with deploying to cloud platforms and architecting scalable services.
* Familiarity with infrastructure-as-code tools (Terraform, Pulumi).
* Strong programming skills and a proven ability to write efficient and maintainable code.
* Excellent problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication skills.



 Nice to have
 


* Strong interest in creative applications of AI.
* Familiarity with GPU-accelerated computing environments.



  





**What we offer** 



* A challenging and fulfilling opportunity to contribute to the development of a groundbreaking creative product.
* A supportive, collaborative, and innovative work environment with a team of like-minded individuals.
* An opportunity to join an early-stage company and influence how we build the company before there are too many processes and structures in place.
* Competitive salary and an attractive equity program in a start-up funded by top investors Creandum (1st investor Spotify, iZettle, depop) and EQT Ventures (Einride, Sonantic). 🦄
* A learning environment, with interesting challenges to solve and an ambitious team to support you.
* Office located in the heart of Stockholm.

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.** 




  





 We are looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) with a proven track record of driving reliability and scalability in dynamic, growth-oriented environments. In this central role, you will bring deep expertise to architect and implement resilient systems, mentor teams on operational excellence, and embed best practices across our infrastructure. Your experience in navigating similar journeys will be instrumental as we elevate our cloud platforms, enhance observability, and set new benchmarks for scalability and performance. Join us in building a world-class, robust infrastructure for the future!
 



  





**How You Will Make An Impact** 



* Champion a Platform Engineering mindset: Developers own their own infrastructure, and we provide the tooling and platform to make it effortless.
* Architect and build scalable, resilient, and observable infrastructure, working closely with development teams to enable seamless delivery and robust testing.
* Foster a collaborative environment through code reviews, pair programming, and mob programming.
* Lead Kubernetes and container management, simplifying operations, optimizing performance, and promoting best practices.
* Coach engineering teams on cloud-native principles, promoting continuous learning and knowledge sharing.



  





**What We're Looking For** 



* Platform Engineering: Play a key role in creating a developer-first platform that streamlines workflows and accelerates productivity.
* Product mindset: Track record of building great products with a user-centric approach to technology choices.
* Architectural knowledge: Deep understanding of modern web architectures, system design, and engineering principles for building scalable and reliable platforms.
* Cloud Native: We are fully cloud-native in GCP (Google Cloud Platform), running our services on GKE with managed databases. Hands-on experience with GCP and managing multiple Kubernetes clusters is essential.
* Observability skills: Expertise in troubleshooting distributed systems, building dashboards (e.g., Grafana), and instrumenting metrics, logs, and traces for monitoring and performance analysis.
* CI/CD proficiency: Strong experience with CI/CD and GitOps operational frameworks. We use GitHub Actions, ArgoCD, and manage all our infrastructure as code using terraform.
* Programming skills: Strong programming skills in Go or Typescript, the primary languages used within our team.
* Mentorship: Experience in mentoring and guiding engineering teams, promoting operational excellence through documentation and best practices.



  





**It would also be music to our ears if you have** 



* Experience with Progressive Delivery and Canary Releases using tools like Argo Rollouts.
* Expertise in managing an Observability stack (We run Thanos, OpenTelemetry with Grafana Tempo, Loki, Grafana, Prometheus).
* Proficiency in defining and tracking Service Level Objectives (SLOs) and Service Level Indicators (SLIs) to enhance system reliability.



  





**Equal Opportunity Employer** 




 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
 



  





**Application** 




 Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
 



  





 We embrace a hybrid work setup that offers the freedom and flexibility to balance your personal and professional life. At the same time, we value the collaboration, creativity, and connection that comes from spending the majority of our time together in the office. This approach allows us to innovate as a team while giving you the autonomy to work in a way that suits you best.

title: Senior Solutions Architect
description:
**Description**
 Automat-it is an all-in AWS Premier partner that empowers startups with DevOps and FinOps expertise and hands-on services. We guide and support hundreds of startups leveraging AWS smarter throughout their growth journey. We save our customers significant time to market and optimize their cloud performance and cost-effectiveness.
   

  

 Automat-it operates in more than seven countries across EMEA. We provide a dynamic environment where you can expand your professional expertise and make a significant impact.
   

  

 In this position as Senior Solutions Architect, you will be a crucial member of the pre-sales process, working with account managers to develop AWS solutions for our startup customers.
   

  

 📍 Work location - Remote within Sweden.
   

  

 ✈️ Travel Requirements: 20% (mainly Stockholm).
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and implement solutions to meet business requirements and create cost-efficient, highly available, and scalable solutions for customers, including Well-Architected reviews and SoW.
* Research and analyze current solutions and initiate improvement plans.
* Collaborate with other engineers and stakeholders to ensure solutions are designed and developed according to best practices.
* Share your knowledge with our customers and the cloud community by participating in public speaking engagements such as workshops, conferences, webinars, and more.
* Frequent travels - locally (on-demand to meet with customers and partners and attend local events) and abroad (at least once a quarter).


**Requirements**
* 3+ years of hands-on experience in an AWS environment, including implementation, migration, and maintenance, designing solutions end-to-end
* 2+ years of experience in technical customer-facing roles, such as Customer Engineering, SRE, Cloud Architect, or equivalent
* 2+ years of experience in an IT environment, including hands-on in Kubernetes, CI/CD, and DevOps tools - advantage
* Proven experience in a production environment, developing software with either Python, Go, Java, or equivalents
* In-depth knowledge of AWS's main services, with an emphasis on Kubernetes and Containers
* Successfully designed DevOps and Infrastructure for high-scale production environments in AWS
* Understanding of Information Security best practices
* Certified AWS Solutions Architect - Associate.
* AWS Solutions Architect Professional or a specialty certification - an advantage
* Ability to effectively communicate technical design in verbal and written formats in front of customers
* Ability to lead an end-to-end engagement with the account management team
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both English and Swedish
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment


 Automat-it is committed to fostering a workplace that promotes equal opportunities for all and believes that a diverse workforce is crucial to our success. Our recruitment decisions are based on your experience and skills, recognizing the value you bring to our team.

title: Senior Software Engineer (full-time)
description:
*At Nexus, part of French IN Groupe, we secure the new society that emerges in the ever-expanding world of digital transformation. By challenging ourselves to go further and do better, we’re developing technology for high-demand global clients. Nexus’ Smart ID solutions and IoT platforms are changing how we perceive trusted identities. Do you want to be a part of our journey?*
*Terje Lindberg,* 
 our Head of the Certificate Manager development team, is looking to strengthen his team with a talented Senior Software Engineer to join our Stockholm office.
   

  

 If you thrive in tech and international environments this might be the right opportunity for you. Give your career a real boost by participating in the digital transformation of society while contributing to securing identities.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Be part of a friendly and skilled team, that enjoys working and hanging out together.
* Work on our own powerful Certificate Authority solutions for people and IoT.
* If you're not already are familiar with the topic of "Public Key Infrastructure" (PKI), you will be in the best possible environment to master it
* Have the opportunity to collaborate and make a difference every day; we are small enough so every individual counts, and big enough for you to have work security and development opportunities.


 Want to know more? Check out our value proposition: To work with us!
   

  

  

  

**What You’ll Do At Nexus**
 Nexus Smart ID Certificate Manager is a flexible and scalable Certificate Authority (CA) software portfolio that is fast growing in the domain of the Internet of Things (IoT).
   

  

* You will thrive on feature development and ensure that our product is easier to deploy, in the cloud, on-premises, or deliver as a service.
* You will take part in architecting the cloud transition and contributing to interesting feature development activities.
* You will work as agile as possible. We have daily stand-ups (remote or on-site) and do proper sprint planning and retros. We highly appreciate your opinion and ownership of driving the agenda.
* We work closely with the customer, therefore, from time to time you will have direct contact with internal and external customers of the product. This can be for new feature development, cloud strategy discussions, PoCs, or PKI ceremonies. We believe in the concept “you develop it, you run it”.


**Some Of Our Tech Stack**
**Application** 
 : Java, Gradle, REST, Docker, Kubernetes
   

  

**Tools** 
 : GIT, Jira, Confluence, SonarQube, Azure Pipelines
   

  

**Concepts** 
 : PKI, aaS, IoT
   

  

**About You**
* You have extensive experience in developing applications in Java and experience with cloud technologies and continuous delivery.
* You enjoy working in an open team and you firmly believe that cooperation and teamwork is the way to succeed. Continuous improvement, working closely together, and discussing is the way to learn from each other.
* You have the DevOps mindset and don’t have any issues sharing your ideas and inspiring people around you.
* You have a strong interest in security, have some experience or you are willing to learn.


**Not sure you meet 100% of the qualifications?**
 At Nexus, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.
   

  

**About Your CV And The Process**
 You will not be asked to do a two-day assignment as a skill assessment, we do real-time tech interviews together with the team and we do not require you to apply with a resume/CV. Who has an updated resume anyway?
   

  

 Transparency, security, and trust are the core of our company; therefore, the final candidate will be subjected to a background check before training.
   

  

 Nexus is an equal-opportunity employer. We truly believe in being ONE Nexus. You are welcomed at Nexus for who you are, no matter where you come from or what you look like. Our technology is for everyone, and so is our workplace. So, bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background to thrive, collaborate, and be forward-thinking! It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep innovating the way we secure the world.

title: IT-specialist – observerbarhet
description:

 Som

 hos

Du kommer dessutom bidra direkt till att säkra teknisk stabilitet och förutsättningar för långsiktig utveckling av avgörande teknik inom en samhällskritisk verksamhet.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:** 



* **Vidareutveckla centrala observerbarhetsplattformar** 
 : Driva utveckling och förbättring av systemen/plattformarna för att säkerställa högsta driftsäkerhet.
* **Incidenthantering och problemlösning** 
 : I nära samarbete med 24/7-systemövervakningsfunktionen, analysera, lösa och dokumentera incidenter och problem.
* **Agera specialist** 
 : Vara primär kontaktväg för systemspecifika frågor och dela din expertis internt.
* **Stötta verksamheten** 
 : Ge viktig support till verksamheten och externa partners.
* **Genomföra ändringar och förbättringar** 
 : Hantera beställningar, underhåll och uppgraderingar enligt Svenska kraftnäts change-process.
* **Dokumentera och specificera tekniska krav** 
 : Arbeta med teamet för att säkra effektiv dokumentation och långsiktig förvaltning.
* **Säkerställa IT-säkerhet, hög tillgänglighet och kvalitet.**



  





**Om dig** 




 För att bli framgångsrik i den här rollen ser vi att du är nyfiken på teknik och utvecklingsorienterad. Du har lätt för att samarbeta och är tydlig och kommunikativ. Vi söker dig om är noggrann, strukturerad och resultatorienterad. Du är självgående och initiativtagande. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





**Skallkrav:** 




 Vidare ser vi att du har en utbildning från högskola eller universitet inom IT eller liknande, alternativt likvärdig kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt.
 



  





 Du har även:
 


* Flerårig erfarenhet av att arbeta med observerbarhetsplattformar
* Flerårig erfarenhet av att förvalta/utveckla applikationer på OpenShift eller annan kubernetesvariant
* Flerårig erfarenhet av att arbeta med Helm samt Kustomize
* Goda kunskaper om att bygga images i Docker/Podman
* Erfarenhet av GitOps-baserade arbetssätt
* Mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska



  





**Meriterande** 
 (ej krav) är arbetslivserfarenhet inom:
 


* APM (Application Performance Management) produkter
* Prometheus/OpenTelemetry alternativt Thanos eller Mimir
* Grafana-stacken



  





**Bra att veta** 



* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg (Stockholm)
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 % #LI-hybrid
* Sista ansökningsdag är
 **2025-02-21** 
 . Vi tar inte emot personligt brev i samband med din ansökan.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning.



  





 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Svenska kraftnät med IDG Recruitment.
 



 Vid frågor, kontakta rekryteringskonsult Alexandra Tihinen,
 **alexandra.tihinen@foundryco.com** 
 , 070-447 92 24, alternativt Maria Sahlén rekryterare hos Svenska kraftnät,
 **maria.sahlen2@svk.se** 
 , 010-489 20 27.
 



  





 Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Mikael Hedenheim, ST, tel. 010-475 84 68. Du når oss också via e-post:
 **fornamn.efternamn@svk.se** 
 .
 



  





**Övrig information** 




 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. title: ETL Developer (NICHE)
description:
Sword Services Greece seeks to recruit a high-caliber individual to join our international team as an ETL Developer. The successful candidate will work in a multinational environment, supporting our clients in developing and optimizing ETL solutions for system integration, data validation, and storage. As an ETL Developer, you will be key in designing, developing, and managing ETL workflows to ensure seamless data processing and integration.
 



  





**What you will do...** 




  




* Design and develop new ETL flows for system integration, automated dataflows, data validation, and storage.
* Contribute to the overall solution architecture, including interfaces, services, infrastructure configuration, security, and access policies.
* Optimize the performance of new and existing ETL flows.
* Conduct testing of ETL solutions and integration testing individually or in collaboration with other teams.
* Manage FME workflows, including job scheduling, resource allocation, error handling, monitoring, and scalability.



  





**What is your experience...** 




  




* Minimum 3 years of experience as an ETL Developer/Engineer using FME.
* Minimum 3 years of experience using SQL, with at least 1 year in Transact-SQL.
* Experience working with work item management tools such as Azure DevOps, TFS, or Jira.
* University degree in Computer Science (or equivalent) with at least 3 years of experience in IT OR a non-university degree with at least 6 years of experience in IT.



  





*Experience in the following will be considered as an asset:* 




  




* Experience in data modeling.
* Knowledge of data warehouse architecture.
* Experience in managing FME workflows, job scheduling, resource allocation, error handling, and monitoring.
* Experience in optimizing ETL flow performance.
* Understanding of software development lifecycles in both Waterfall and Agile/DevOps modes.
* Advanced Transact-SQL skills.
* Experience in SSIS.
* Knowledge of DevOps practices, CI/CD, and automation.
* Experience producing and maintaining technical documentation.
* Proactive communication and collaboration skills within a multidisciplinary team.
* Experience working in an Agile environment.
* Experience working in a multicultural context.



  





**Personal Characteristics…** 




  




* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Detail-oriented with a commitment to delivering high-quality solutions.
* Ability to manage tasks and projects proactively to meet agreed deadlines.
* Capable of working effectively and efficiently with diverse teams, including Development, Testing, and Project Management.



  





**Applications must be in the English language.** 




**No Visa Sponsorship.**

title: Tech Lead for Production Core unit with great Java skills, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
*Are you an experienced software Java developer looking to take the next step in your career? Do you want to lead a dynamic team at one of the Nordic region's largest companies? If you have a passion for full-stack development and cloud platforms, this is the job for you!*
**Join us**
 The IT department at PostNord consists of a dedicated team responsible for driving innovation and delivering high-quality software solutions. Our mission is to support the organization's strategic goals by developing scalable and efficient systems. We foster a collaborative and inclusive culture where every team member's contribution is valued.
   

  

**Job Duties**
 As a Tech Lead at PostNord, you will be responsible for guiding our development team and ensuring the successful delivery of software projects. Your role will include:
   

  

* Leading the design, development, and deployment of full-stack applications
* Building and maintaining microservice architecture
* Implementing best practices in software development and ensuring code quality
* Improve and review technical processes to enhance productivity
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
* Mentoring and coaching team members to foster their professional growth
* Driving the adoption of Agile methodologies and DevOps practices
* Ensuring the stability and scalability of our applications in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, or GCP).


 ,
   

  

**Need-to-have**
* Several years of experience in software Java development with a strong emphasis on full-stack development
* High proficiency in Java, Spring Boot or Quarkus
* Good understanding of Angular, Vue, or an equivalent frontend framework
* Experience in building microservices
* Experience with messaging and streaming solutions using ActiveMQ, Kafka, and Kafka Streams
* Experience with Git, Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift, Portainer, and CI/CD tools like Bitbucket Pipelines and GitHub Actions
* Experience with relational Database like Oracle or Postgres and non-relational like
* Understanding of container orchestration platforms and experience deploying production software
* Solid understanding of software architecture, design patterns, and best practices
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think critically
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Proven track record of delivering high-quality software solutions on schedule
* Experience with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices is a plus
* Fluent in english in speaking and writing


**Nice-to-have**
* Mobile app development
* Fluent in Swedish


**We believe you are a person that is**
* Thorough, analytical, and quick to learn new systems
* Inclusive, structured, and responsible in your working style
* Able to handle stressful situations and prioritize tasks independently
* Communicative and easy to collaborate with, building and nurturing long-term relationships


**We offer you**
**Benefits**
 We offer a variety of work in an international environment with constantly new challenges and quick decisions. Here you have opportunities to develop creative solutions and work in a prestige-free group where we jointly help to reach our goals. PostNord is one of Sweden's largest workplaces and we offer safe employment conditions and benefits. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:
   

  

* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment. Watch the video about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are in a constant transformation and work consistently to develop both our offer and our employees, all to achieve our vision of being The favorite carrier of the Nordics. We are PostNord - a fantastic company to work and grow with. Read more at postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 We look forward to receive your application!
   

  

 If you have any questions or concerns, please contact manager Carolina Lunde on carolina.lunde@postnord.com. Don't wait to submit your application as we go through the applications on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 For union representatives, visit: Facklig kontakt | PostNord

title: Lead Azure Engineer
description:
### **Assignment Description**


* Support for Azure Infrastructure Development and identity access management.
* Assist the ROSS organization in defining, designing, and developing Azure infrastructure for the Core offering.
* Provide guidance to ensure that the high-level conceptual model of the Core offering is detailed, enabling teams to understand the requirements and contribute to planning and building effectively.
* Collaborate key stakeholders.
* Work closely with the Azure Cloud Excellence (ACE) team, tenant leaders/coordinators, the ROSS architect lead and other teams to ensure seamless integration and alignment with organizational goals.
* Support of Retail Tenant.
* Support in infrastructure question connected to the initial transition of the D365 platform, Retailer integration platform, and Power platform within the new tenant.
* Assist in deploying additional new services according to the defined timeline.
* Retailer and Franchisee Engagement.
* Support in the facilitation of accessing the retailers and franchisees to the tenant, ensuring the successful deployment of the new Core offering.
* Proactive Infrastructure and IAM Planning.
* Ensure that the Azure infrastructure is built to address defined requirements early in the process.
* Anticipate and manage relevant issues proactively, providing strategic insights for future developments.
* Providing outside-in perspectives on how to manage the way of working & transition and the future set up.

title: Specialistsäljare till Atea Software, Cloud & Services
description:
Vill du arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där du får möjlighet att utveckla försäljningsstrategier för framtidens moln- och tjänstelösningar? Hos Atea Software, Cloud & Services söker vi nu en Specialistsäljare som vill vara en del av ett engagerat team och bidra till våra kunders framgångar.


**Din roll på Atea**
--------------------



I rollen som Specialistsäljare kommer du att spela en central roll i att utveckla och genomföra försäljningsstrategier för våra moln- och tjänstelösningar. Du arbetar nära kunderna för att identifiera deras behov och erbjuda skräddarsydda lösningar som hjälper dem att nå sina affärsmål.



Exempel på dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:


* Utveckla och genomföra försäljningsstrategier för moln- och tjänstelösningar.
* Bygga och underhålla starka kundrelationer.
* Identifiera och följa upp nya affärsmöjligheter.
* Samarbeta med interna team för att säkerställa kundnöjdhet.
* Delta i marknadsförings- och försäljningsevent.

**Ditt Team**
-------------



Du blir en del av ett team med 7 engagerade kollegor med placering i Göteborg och Borås. Vi värdesätter ett öppet klimat och arbetar tätt tillsammans för att nå gemensamma mål. Våra kollegor har varierande erfarenhet och kompetenser, men vi delar alla en passion för vårt arbete och ett driv att utvecklas tillsammans.


**Vad vi söker hos dig**
------------------------



Vi tror på dig och dina personliga kompetenser som är avgörande för att lyckas i rollen och trivas hos oss. Du är kommunikativ, relationsskapande och har ett affärstänk som hjälper dig att identifiera kundbehov och skapa värde.



För att lyckas i tjänsten som Specialistsäljare ser vi att du har:


* Erfarenhet av försäljning inom IT-branschen, gärna med fokus på mjukvara, moln- och tjänstelösningar.
* Stark kommunikations- och förhandlingsförmåga.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och i team.
* Resultatorienterad med en stark drivkraft att nå och överträffa mål.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.

  


**Vårt löfte till dig**
-----------------------



Hos oss får du vara med att bidra till ett smartare, effektivare och mer hållbart samhälle. Med fokus på utveckling, laganda och personligt ansvarstagande ser vi till att göra skillnad. Vi uppmuntrar och stöttar varandra, och tar vara på våra individuella förmågor, perspektiv och erfarenheter. Det är därför du är viktig för oss. För att du är du, för att du är nyfiken och för att du vill växa professionellt – och som människa. Tillsammans skapar vi laget som bygger Sverige med it.


**Kontakt & mer information**
-----------------------------



Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Christer Adolfsson, Försäljningschef Software i Region Väst via christer.adolfsson@atea.se. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Ansök redan idag!


**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan till oss!**

  


**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Analytiker inom Power BI och Analytics
description:
Vill du vara med och skapa datadrivna insikter som gör verklig skillnad? Har du en passion för analys, visualisering och affärsutveckling? Då kan du vara den vi söker!


**Din roll på Atea**
--------------------



Atea Sverige söker nu en analytiker med gedigen kompetens inom Power BI och Analytics till vårt affärsområde Software, Cloud & Services. I en tid då data blir allt viktigare för att skapa kundvärde och affärsnytta, kommer du att spela en central roll i att utveckla våra analyser, rapporter och beslutsunderlag.



 Som analytiker hos oss kommer du att:


* Bygga och vidareutveckla rapporter och dashboards i Power BI för att ge verksamheten insiktsfulla verktyg för framtida prognoser.
* Analysera affärsdata för att identifiera trender, möjligheter och risker.
* Ge verksamheten värdefulla, datadrivna rekommendationer.
* Samarbeta med kollegor över olika affärsområden för att skapa innovativa och smarta lösningar.
* Automatisera och effektivisera processer kring rapportering och analys.

**Vad vi söker hos dig**
------------------------



För att lyckas i denna roll tror vi att du har:


* Gedigen erfarenhet av Power BI samt andra relevanta analysverktyg.
* Erfarenhet av SQL och Sharepoint
* God förståelse för datamodellering och BI-strukturer.
* Förmåga att omvandla komplex data till insiktsfulla visualiseringar och tydliga affärsrekommendationer, anpassade för en bred målgrupp
* En analytisk, lösningsorienterad och proaktiv inställning.
* Vi söker dig som vågar ta initiativ och sprida dina insikter och analyser över hela Atea.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med datakvalitet och governance


Meriterande om du har:


* erfarenhet av licens- och SaaS-affären


Vi ser gärna att du har en stark affärsmässig inställning och ett stort eget driv. Om du är nyfiken, engagerad och trivs med att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där data skapar värde – då är du rätt person för oss.


**Vårt löfte till dig**
-----------------------



Hos oss får du vara med att bidra till ett smartare, effektivare och mer hållbart samhälle. Med fokus på utveckling, laganda och personligt ansvarstagande ser vi till att göra skillnad. Vi uppmuntrar och stöttar varandra, och tar vara på våra individuella förmågor, perspektiv och erfarenheter. Det är därför du är viktig för oss. För att du är du, för att du är nyfiken och för att du vill växa professionellt – och som människa. Tillsammans skapar vi laget som bygger Sverige med it.


**Kontakt & mer information**
-----------------------------



Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef, Ulrika Nordenberg via ulrika.nordenberg@atea.se. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, ansök därmed redan idag. Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater även en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.



Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.

title: Strategic Account Manager
description:
**Strategic Account Manager – North Europe**



OpenEye, an innovator in the design and development of cloud-centric software solutions for commercial video management systems, is seeking a Strategic Account Manager.



As a Strategic Account Manager (SAM) for Cloud Surveillance, you will be responsible for managing and nurturing key accounts, developing long-term relationships with new strategic customers, and driving new business opportunities across Northern Europe. You will also be responsible for engaging with consultants and A&E specialists to drive OpenEye specifications through our channel network.



Your role will involve a combination of strategic account management, business development, and solution selling, ensuring we meet the unique needs of our customers and continue to expand our footprint in the region.


**Responsibilities:**


**Account Management:**


* Own and manage a portfolio of key accounts partners in the Northern Europe region, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction and retention.
* Develop and execute tailored account strategies to maximize revenue and long-term value from each partner.
* Regularly engage with C-level executives, decision-makers, and other key stakeholders within customer organizations.


**New Business Development:**


* Identify and prospect new opportunities within the Northern Europe region, focusing on large enterprise customers, regional businesses, and government sectors, again ensuring engagement at C-Level.
* Qualify new business opportunities and drive the sales process from discovery to contract closure.
* Build strong relationships with new and potential customers to expand the market share for cloud surveillance solutions.
* Contribute & respect the wider Enterprise team in North America, making sure strategic & tactical alignment.


**Solution Selling & Strategy:**


* Act as a trusted advisor to clients, offering strategic insights and demonstrating how our cloud surveillance solutions can address their specific challenges.
* Collaborate with the technical and product teams to ensure that customer requirements are met, and provide feedback to improve the product offerings.
* Lead complex sales negotiations and close deals while ensuring customer needs are aligned with our product capabilities.


**Cross-functional Collaboration:**


* Work closely with the customer success, product, and marketing teams to ensure seamless execution of solutions and that customer expectations are met.
* Provide feedback on market trends, competitor activities, and customer needs to inform business strategy and product development.


**Market Insights & Reporting:**


* Monitor market trends, emerging technologies, and competitor offerings in the cloud surveillance and security sectors.
* Provide regular reports on account status, sales performance, pipeline, and customer feedback.


**Regional Representation:**


* Represent the company at industry events, trade shows, and customer meetings across Northern Europe.
* Be the go-to expert for cloud surveillance in your region, positioning the company as a leader in security solutions.


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree or equivalent industry experience.
* Minimum 5 years outside sales experience, preferably in a technology discipline.
* 3 years "Business to Business" sales experience.
* Strong territory management skills.
* Ability to travel overnight 70% – 85% of the time, including some weekends.
* Proficient in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and CRM software.
* Demonstrate a team-oriented mindset.
* Possess corporate-level presentation/reporting abilities.
* Technical aptitude.
* Account development skills.
* Microsoft/networking certifications, preferred.
* Cloud SaaS Sales Experience, preferred.
* Video Surveillance Management Systems Sales Experience, preferred.


**OpenEye is an Equal Opportunity Employer**



In connection with your application, we collect information that identifies, reasonably relates to or describes you ("Personal Information"). The categories of Personal Information that we may collect include your name, government-issued identification number(s), email address, mailing address, other contact information, emergency contact information, employment history, educational history, criminal record, and demographic information. We collect and use those categories of Personal Information about you for human resources and other business management purposes, including identifying and evaluating you as a candidate for potential or future employment or future positions, recordkeeping in relation to recruiting and hiring, conducting criminal background checks as permitted by law, conducting analytics, and ensuring compliance with applicable legal requirements and Company policies.
